description:
Good for game day kind of bar or hosting events, such as YPN, which I came here for. 

I like the outdoor seatings when the sun permits.

Bar bite munchies are yum with the drinks! 

Cheers!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Gotta love bad commercial music.
Gotta love a super packed place with 21yo Bros...
And gotta love paying $15 for literally the WORST margarita ever...unless you like cheap ass tequila with gatorade...
author: Clement P.

description:
6 months ago Sabrosa would've earned a solid 4-4.5 stars. 

Fast forward to a month ago- 
I heard they got a new chef. Taco Tuesday had $2 tacos, $2 tecates, and $4 margaritas. Tacos were literally just meat and grilled onion which is great and totally fine because they are $2! But the margaritas were the best part. Service is terrible. They had one server and one bartender on Tuesday night where they are offering insane specials. Drinks would take 20-30 minutes, even for beer! 

Friend went back last week and margaritas have gone up to $6 and still has the same terrible service. It's a pass for me.
author: Whitney P.

description: Had a great girls night out! There was $5 cover but were comped it when we unfortunately (fortunately?) didn't have cash. Tip your bartender! We were very well  taken care of after round one.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I was overcharged. Would not recommend.
author: Armen S.

description:
Sabrosa means "delicious" in Spanish and while the food is all right, it isn't sabrosa enough to be titled such.

My friend wanted to check this place out but admitted that it wasn't kid-friendly enough to check out with her 10-year-old son. So she brought me instead. The first thought we had when we stepped in: "The music's too loud," she said, echoing my unspoken sentiments. Turn down the music at least 10 decibels and I can add a star.

The food: We got three happy hour specials: tacos dorados, pico de gallo with chips, and buffalo wings. The tacos dorados were fine. Rolled up with a little bean dip, they were crunchy and sabrosa. Probably the best of the three dishes. Pico de gallo was not pico de gallo, but it sounds better than calling it what it actually was: chopped tomatoes. No cilantro or lime juice, and very little onion. Buffalo wings were standard. Service was very average.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. Unfortunately, I didn't. Simple as that. Let's start off by stating that I came on a Tuesday or Wednesday night, so it was guaranteed to be low key and fairly empty. No issues with the service, the cleanliness of the restaurant, or the drinks. In fact, my margarita was fantastic. It was the food that really disappointed me. 

My boyfriend and I got there early enough that we were able to take advantage of the happy hour menu. We ordered some nachos and then shared a plate of fajitas (not on the happy hour menu) for our dinner. The nachos were over toasted, as if someone forgot and left them in the oven for too long. Some of the chips were a little burnt, and we paid extra for chicken and there was barely any on it. Plus, all the toppings were splattered right on top, so it seemed that after the first third of the nachos, you really didn't have anything other than tortilla chips left. 

What really got me though were the fajitas. Fajita meat should be cut into strips with cooked peppers and onions on the side. the peppers and onions were pretty much raw and the fajita meat was cut into tiny pieces mixed into the peppers and onions. It's as almost as if they didn't want us to find the meat or notice how little of it there was! For what we paid (even with the happy hour special), it was too much for the quality and amount of food. Definitely walked away disappointed.
author: Sally Y.

description:
Before I begin this review, I understand that this place is known for its drinking & nightlife aspect more than food. That being said...

I came here for brunch because why not! 12pm on a Saturday in the Marina & only 3 other tables were filled - that should've been our first clue.

We ordered $12 chips and guac because why not! They took 40 minutes to come out and only after a friend asked the waitress where the guac was...it tasted fine but it was literally 6 chips. $12 for 6 chips? No thank you.

Still waiting...at that 40 minute mark the waitress comes by because she needed to clarify something about our order from when we arrived, not even mentioning the wait or that our food will be out soon (this was pre-chips so we were hangry and confused since the place was literally empty) 

The Food: Finally came out! Yay! The eggs looked like a kids science project gone wrong and they managed to burn pancakes...Really how do you burn a pancake...(a $15 pancake, bacon, egg plate too)

If you like terrible service and food that a 6 year old could cook better, come here. If you want better this is the Marina and there are a lot of brunch options elsewhere - or microwave some pancakes at home because I assure you it will taste better than this 

However if you want an overpriced shot of vodka I'm sure they will be able to do that right...
author: Heather R.

description:
Okay, so I went to Sabrosa last night for dinner and drinks with friends. It was a good time but I was underwhelmed. Not sure if I just had high hopes for it after seeing it Instagram, or what. I felt catfished. every photo I've seen of it, it looks so fun, but when I got there the biggest impression I got, was that it looked kinda sad. 

We came in around 8:15. Half of the tables were sat. The bar was about half empty. We were sat by hostess immediately. 

The waitress was nice and attentive. 

We had passion fruit margaritas. They were delicious!

We ordered chips and salsa to start (basic alert). The 3 different types of salsas were yummy. 

For our entree, we basically each ordered 3 tacos. 
I had the braised short ribs, fish, and steak. 
I was looking forward to the braised short ribs the most, but was the most disappointed by it. Although there was a lot  of meat on it, it was super dry and hard to enjoy. The fish was good, I didn't love it but I liked it a lot. The steak taco was definitely my favorite one. It was delicious. 

At around 9:50, they told us that at 10pm they would have to take our table and chairs away, which was fine with us. At around 9:45ish, it slowly started filling with people who were out for drinks and dancing. We left shortly after that, but I'm sure it's a great place to go out to with friends on the weekends for a late night.
author: Tati C.

description: This bar doesn't respect the neighborhood. The place is swarming with drunk frat dudes and the bouncers do nothing to help with noise control. I have written and called and they ignore my requests to keep the music down and door closed. It's a very disrespectful business - on the other hand, balboa across the street has a similar crowd but their bounces and doormen are very skilled at keeping the noise down. They are aware this is a neighborhood and people are trying to sleep (especially during the weekdays). I'm shocked they allow this bar to stay in business.
author: Lady N.

description: Don't waste your time with this shit hole. Terrible service, overpriced disgusting drinks xoxo
author: Haleigh G.

description:
Happened to walk by Sunday while looking for a place to have a drink outside in the sunshine. Snagged a table and a few house margs. 
It was so loud inside it was hard to hear my friend outside! But I can't blame them too much; they were playing fun music and a couple times everyone inside was singing along. :) They also had a bunch of old school board games that you can play (hungry hippos, guess who, scrabble, battleship, etc.). 
Margs were too sweet. Quesadilla was delicious. Chips and pico disappointing. But a fun spot. Happy hour 4-7pm.
author: Kari E.

description:
My first mistake was coming here for dinner on a Saturday night around 8:30pm right when the Marina bros are coming out to play. My second mistake was thinking that it could be halfway decent anyways.

I'll make it short and sweet: The atmosphere was obnoxious and the food wasn't good. $12 for chips and guac and they give you enough guac for about 5 chips. They couldn't even make a decent quesadilla. How do you mess up a quesadilla? Also asked for added guac (after the app didn't satisfy my craving), and got about a teaspoon full.

If you don't already avoid this place for the crowd, avoid it for the food.
author: Jessie K.

description:
Pretty bad experience not gonna lie. ..

Came here party of 3 for Sunday brunch. My friend had a baby fly in her glass so she asked a server if she could change the water and glasses.  A younger female server with heavy makeup and a Raiders top begrudgingly came over,  grabbed each glass and violently tossed the water on the sidewalk,  with such force my friend got her clothes splashed on. She even splashed the car that was parked and made a few pedestrians jump.  Food took about 35 minutes to come out and the people who came after us got served first.  I get it, privilege.  All the other servers were really nice though. 

Huevos Rancheros 
- decent, nothing special.   It was a little watery but not too bad

Unfortunately this was just highly overpriced Mexican food joint with with a salty staff member. 2 stars for no diarrhea!
author: Tina A.

description:
I tried this spot for the first time for brunch today and it was pretty good!  

I love the decor/look to this place.  It's very open and has a Latino theme.  There's even some outdoor seating.

I ordered a "fully loaded" Bloody Mary, which had bacon and shrimp!  It looked pretty awesome but was a bit on the too spicy side.  Again not bad, just not something I'd want to order again.  

Also if you check in on Yelp, you get free chips and three salsas, which is normally $6.  The chips and salsa were really good.  I particularly enjoyed the guacamole.  

For my main entree I ordered the avocado eggs benedict and I added bacon to it (per the recommendation of our waitress).  Honestly this entree was delicious.  Lots of avocado and the eggs were perfect.  The bacon really made it complete!  Definitely would get this again.  

When you order coffee, they give you the hugest mug ever, it's kind of comical.  I wouldn't recommend the coffee - it's pretty basic.  

The service here is pretty great, our waitress was very helpful and attentive.  

Overall, I would return to this spot because the entree was delicious and it was easy to get a table.  They also offer a bottomless mimosas option for $22.
author: Michelle S.

description:
We came here at around 2pm on a Saturday for a friend's birthday. We had a large table reserved but the place remained pretty slow through out our stay. 

We ordered two pitchers of the Sangria Margarita ($44 ea/ supposedly serves 4 each but it was so sweet that we had to water it down. So one pitcher probably gave us 10 cups worth of liquid. Also since we watered it down, we tasted no alcohol). We also shared an appetizer of Ceviche ($14/ It was different than the usual ceviche I've had at other places and it was really tart), a 3 Street Tacos ($14/ This was the best dish), and a Red Mexican Rice ($5/ Nothing special but I was craving rice).

I think the food was only an okay and I will not order a pitcher next time. I tried my friend's drink of Dos Besos, which she ordered on her own, and it was also super sweet. Perhaps their drinks are just on the sweet side. 

I did like their bathroom. It was clean and open. 

I'm not sure if I'll visit here again but we shall see...
author: Alice L.

description:
Ouch. 

Reading the most recent reviews of Sabrosa, I did NOT have confidence coming in here. But it was convenient to my friend who had a wax appointment (another ouchie) at Habit next door. With the warm, open dining room, Sabrosa is perfect for casual date nights and big group dinners. The seats at the U-shaped bars are welcoming to solo diners. 

What a coincidence that it was Taco Tuesday on the day we came for their happy hour! That means: $3 tacos and $7 Tommy's margarita! We each had 2 margies (always with salt on the rim!) so we were set. I had the taco de pescado (seared fish, grilled pineapple, avocado salsa) and the taco de cameron (shrimp, chile de arbol, avocado, mango) both were nicely sized, but the flour tortilla was served at room temperature. However, given the price for HH, basically $1.50 each taco =150 pennies, I ain't complaining! :-)

It was also ironic that when I came here, it was my 3rd day in a row having Mexican food #fattystatus but whatever! So, my standards were definitely high considering I dined at an authentic taqueria in the Mission and at the newly opened hotspot Flores on Union st. But due to the friendly service we got and the amazing value for Taco Tuesday, 4 solid stars!
author: Janice C.

description:
Came here for brunch with 7 other people, so it was great we had a reservation. However the server was SO slow in getting our drink orders. My friend ordered a specialty drink, and it was 20 minutes before the server came back and told her that they were out of one of the ingredients to make the drink. But of course, because it took so long, they left the drink charge on our bill.

For the food itself, we got the Yelp deal for the salsa trio and chips, which were tasty. I shared the Mexican French Toast and the Huevos Rancheros with Carnitas with a friend, and the French toast was the highlight. It was really well made and chocolate sauce never hurt nobody. However, there was really not that much meat in the huevos rancheros and it was mainly just a bowl of sauce and eggs. Tasty but definitely not worth the price for what you get.
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place is fucking RACIST AND SEXIST. I'm Not a fucking activist however I got denied drinks even though I paid in full $24 and they would not let me in because they thought I was being disrespectful however I saw a white straight males asked the same question and they would not let me in when I paid the amount of money they would not let me back in because it is not respect my opinion nor my transaction this is actually sexist. The bartender took away my drink after i took one sip but i paid in Full $24 fuck this place. Fuck these people. They denied my friend a WATER. I KNOW it sounda crazy but ir ACTUALLY HAPPENED. Fuck this place.?????

THE BARTENDER'S NAME IS AUSTIN. #FIREAUSTIN #FIREAUSTIN
author: Myra F.

description:
Look, it was our fault for not looking into the place before deciding to do dinner there.  It's the Marina.  But man, if you are going to serve what we felt was actually pretty good food and look vaguely like a restaurant, try and act like one and not have the DJ blasting LMFAO type music at 7:00.

Also, good lord.  drinks.  slow as heellll.

But, if you want to be amused by watching a bunch of wannabe VCs and wannabe VC wives with "careers" in sales/pr/marketing who all look EXACTLY the same with the blonde hair, overdone makeup and same clothes, then you'll at least have fun on that front.

Again.  Turn. Down. The. Music. Until the kids are drunk and it's a legit meat market.
author: Jason H.

description: Came here for dinner with me and my girls on a Friday night. It was pretty busy there was a football game on lots of cute boys out!!! This is the place to be !!! I ordeeeed the three taco plate, one chicken steak and shrimp and soooo good!!! Compliments to the chef. My friend got the cheviche and that was super good too. I recommend this place super fun and great food and enviornment :)))))
author: Sasha G.

description: This place is the worst, overpriced drinks and is known for petty thefts. I know ~5 people who have gotten their wallets and phones stolen there in the past few weeks
author: Malia T.

description:
Hey 
I've lost my passport last night, can you please let me know if you guys find it ? 
I appreciate it !!
author: Deise G.

description:
Overall: Definitely don't waste your time going here. It's not only out of the way for tourists, it's not worth it.

Cons: Extremely overpriced. $40 margaritas we're mostly ice. The waitress was not only really show and inattentive, she almost neglected to honor a coupon my party had revealed to her from the start. The restaurant also didn't advertise that there would be an extremely loud DJ playing all night on a Thursday. The restaurant is all hard surfaces and there was nowhere to speak to your party at the dining tables.

Pros: the food we got was delicious and the portions were reasonably sized. 



.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
-birthday party of 25, called ahead for 20 (Halloween weekend)
- waited 1 hour for bottomless mimosas, 2 hours for food
- ordered 3 tacos: these were the worst tacos I have ever had, and that is not a hyperbole. The menu promises meat, guac and salsa. I received leather hard tortillas (they hurt my teeth to eat), charred meat, lettuce and pico de Gallo (expecting salsa roja). 
-I mentioned the lack of guac to the waiter, and he provided that on the side to other members of the party. Not me tho 
-not one person In The 25 person party had anything better to say about their food than "ok"
-service and food quality was a spectacular fail
- we were told that there was a temporary staff in the back and perhaps that was the reason for the terrible experience. Owner should take not
- ALSO: tried to use yelp check in offer. Waiter said: I've never seen that in my life, and did not honor.
author: Kylee L.

description:
If you come here on a Saturday night be prepared to wait in line. Decided to check this place out since Make End West was charging a $35 cover for our group and this place had no cover fee. The line can take a while and bouncers were meh. We kept seeing people leaving the place but they still wouldn't let our group in. 

We came here mainly for drinks so can't really comment on the food. It was pretty easy to get the attention of the bartenders (at least for our group) and the drinks were OK. A little overpriced for drinks that basically tasted like lemon water imo. On a Saturday night this place is packed and it's basically a huge room so not many places to sit or move since they stack up the tables/chairs on the side of the place. 

If lines are too long at other places, it's a chill place to try but definitely not wow'd by this place to make it a go to on a night out.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Incredibly rude staff, won't even attempt to visit again. If you choose to visit, make sure you bring cash and patience to deal with rude staff trying to create false demand.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Great setting with great music and food. I'd like to point out a bartender named Jeremy who likes to put his undivided attention to the people. He's very fast and quick on his feet. I asked him what drink he recommended and served me the tastiest Long Island I've ever had in my existence. Will definitely be coming back thanks to Jeremy's work ethic and experience he gave me.
author: Alex M.

description:
Thank you Kyle & Sean for amazing customer service. 
The food was delicious from the guacamole to the "street Tacos" everything is so rich in flavor
I ordered 2 carne Asada
1 carnitas
1 pollo
1 shrimp
1 fish

And the carne Asada tacos, make sure to get it with fried cheese... AMMMMAZING!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
My phone, my friend's jacket, along with at least one other customer's phone were stolen in one night. 
It can't be easy to work at a bar in the Marina on a Friday night, but there is no reason to be downright rude. The staff there did not show any sympathy or offer any help, and the bouncer was super aggressive with me. 
This was all after waiting in line for 45 minutes, paying a cover, and buying overpriced drinks. We won't be returning.
author: Tara A.

description:
My wife and I came here on a weekend. I ordered one drink and paid $20. For some reason the bartender thought I wanted to tip her $10+. When I asked for change she was agrivated and short changed me. 

Later we went up to the bar to order a second drink.  The first bartender said something to the bartender servings me and my wife and we were then ignored. We had to ask a random person to order our drinks because no one would take our order.

Apart from the petty attitude this place was over capacity, smelly, and very aggressive. Steer clear.
author: Luis B.

description: Sabrosa was once a fun and exciting place to go in the Marina but since eastside West has closed they charge a 10 dollar cover for entrance after 10 pm...this isn't Vegas.
author: Amani T.

description: First I give HUGE PROPS to the manager of this restaurant. Professional and knows how to take care of customers. I changed my stars from 1 to 4 because of him! Ordered off of a "Limited menu", took FOREVER to get 3 tacos and a nachos. Carne asada tacos were dry and burnt and the nachos were basic (see pic). Waited almost half an hour for drinks, drank them and sat waiting for our elusive sever to return.
author: Debra L.

description: Dear business owner you need to change the security at the door. We have been waiting at the line  for 30 mins for no reason. They say it is over capacity but tons of people leave the place and no one gets in. It is not fun. Definitely not coming again.
author: Serkan S.

description: The food is sup par. Just the typical overpriced Americanized Mexican food. Some staff is rude and racist from what I've seen in previous posts and from what happened to me. I got kicked out for rolling my ankle on the bouncer's foot (I've been nursing an ankle injury), so he assumed I was too drunk. He wouldn't listen to me when I tried to explain. The part that infuriated me was when the bouncer threatened to have me arrested when I kept asking to get let back in. He then physically grabs me and takes me across the street. Then he taunts me with handcuffs while I'm waiting for my friends. I think his name was Kyle. Two stars for the cute bartender Megan.
author: Alan C.

description: I wish we could give more stars, the service was outstanding. She was very caring and attentive. The queso was so watered down and added asada was awful. A complete disappointment. I could not even eat the taco salad I ordered definitely not returning.
author: Dee D.

description: The blonde bartender here tried to steal our money. We ordered one drink and paid with a $20. She didn't bring back change assuming we were tipping her $10+. When we asked for our change she got pissed. Later she told the other bartenders not to serve us. Amateur hour.
author: Julia C.

description: came to meet up with some friends here.  had a few drinks and went pee.  it was a successful night.  didnt stay here too long.  went bar hopping.  overall a cool place to hang out for drinks.  the bathrooms were clean for a bar.  i was surprised.  6 shots and 2 beer chasers was 75$.  not bad.
author: Matthew G.

description: Awesome for dancing as well as being social! If you have a big group of girls this place is perfect for you but get there early cus sometimes they even make girls pay if it's too packed
author: Halle O.

description:
The guacamole was decent. The highlight was that it had pomegranate seeds in it.

Had an epazote quesadilla. It did not do my peoples' food justice.

I love the Marina, but this spot evokes everything that's wrong with the Marina. Frat boys, girls pretending to not be as smart as they are, guys flexing, girls scouting for the fattest wallet. Barf. Out.

Disappointed. Shall not return.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Perfect for a young couple's date or a group. Great food. Great vibe. Stick around after dinner - nightlife at Sabrosa is great.

Sabrosa Grade Card:

* Food: A-
(Mexican with a twist. Great ceviche)

* Service: A
(Quick and polite. Blonde bartender is great, Remembers your drink)

* Music: A
(DJ killed with old school mix)

* Crowd: B+
(Fun and friendly. Decent ratio)

* Location: B+
(Right in the middle of the Marina district action. Parking is difficult, but where is it easy?)
author: John G.

description: Love this bar, definitely one of the top bars in the Marina, but would suggest to get  here early on weekends. Place gets pretty pack as the night goes on. All the bartenders were super nice and very helpful on suggestion drinks, even though they were really busy. Definitely would recommend this place!
author: Stephen S.

description: My experience here was excellent. I feel like there's alot of heart when it comes to making the food here and also with the service here. The atmosphere is real warming and family like or at least what a family should be like. The place is immaculately clean. The burrito and cocktails are super good. I love this place, it's beautiful. This place is very authentic and opens you up to the great Mexican culture. I love the overhead music. I even met some cool customers here. They have alot of organic ingredients too. I mean I believe all restaurants should have organic ingredients and this place proves my point very well. The food here actually tastes healthy and good for you . My friends loved it. We laughed and had a great time here. The prices aren't bad either. I had plenty of money to spend on entertainment after.
author: Luke S.

description:
I am currently waiting outside this bar, being barred from entry despite being already inside about 10 minutes earlier - I left to get the birthday girls jacket.  It is 30 minutes to close and my friends (currently celebrating their 21st birthday) are still inside. I asked if I could just tell them I would be outside, no. I asked if he could tell them if I would be outside (they were visible from the door), no. 

Considering the over priced drink I had to leave inside, it definitely left a poor taste in my mouth. Pretty crappy to make your paying customers wait outside. I understand having a cut off point, but it was 10 minutes before appropriate to cut off entrance. 

By the way, I saw your bouncer let people in when they said they "worked in bars". Not cool.
author: Kelly M.

description:
It truly disappoints me that I have to be writing this sort of review for a bar that myself and my friends have always enjoyed going to. 
Last night we got to Sabrosa a lot later than normal and did not feel like paying to spend 30 min in the bar. So we waited outside to call our Uber and I noticed a young woman stumbling out with a guy. The only reason I felt I should pay attention to this was because the guy looked at me and said "no problems, only opportunities" as he groped this girl that was extremely intoxicated. Long story short, he leaves her and she's stumbling around outside by herself. I stopped her and asked if she wanted me to call her an Uber, she kept refusing. I asked if she knew where she was, she said "not really." I offered to even get in the Uber with her to make sure she made it home. She refused and refused, tried to go back into Sabrosa and the bouncer stopped her and told her she had to leave. (So clearly, he has taken a look at her and could absolutely identify her if she tried to go back in). This girl comes back out and says she wanted water...
Here is where my issue begins with Sabrosa. The bouncer, a very tall, big man with long curly hair refuses to get water for us. We walk a little bit towards the back door of Sabrosa and try and get this girl in an Uber some more. She bolts back into Sabrosa and the bouncer lets her in. I asked him if she got in and why he would let her in knowing she could very easily be put in an awful situation, she has no idea where she is, no clue where her friends are at, didn't know the last time she had been with her friends that night. She could barely walk! Two of us were holding her up and the bouncer just let her go right back in. When I asked where she went his responses were "who?" To which I explained some more. He says "oh, a drunk girl?" And scoffs. I get it, you see tons of drunk girls each night but this was different and you knew exactly who I was talking about. After about 2 minutes of trying to get in to find her he says "I'm a bouncer, not a babysitter." To which I told him off and he said "hey, you're a Good Samaritan, good for you but that ain't my job." 
AS THE MANAGER (a women) SAT AT THE FRONT DOOR WATCHING THIS ALL HAPPEN.
I just want to make a clear note that it actually is your job, working at a bar, to know when someone has had enough and needs to be cut off. The front door staff at Sabrosa are some of the worst that I've come across and it blows my mind that they were all witness to this belligerent girl, but continued to turn a blind eye rather than help.
author: Summer ..

description: - I attended this bar last night. As I was waiting for my Lyft minding my own business a woman approached me and ASKED for help. She wanted help to get away from male who followed her out. I did my best and tried to walk her back to Sabrosa. That's when the male got aggressive with me and told me to mind my own business. I walked back to the club and asked for the bouncers for help. This is when one of he bouncers came up to me and pretty much gave me the "dont worry about it the male is a regular member" and shes drunk and to mind my own business speech. I was appalled and also baffled when he also expressed he was some "Doctor". Basically telling me it's OK for this male take advantage of this female. The bouncer was a white male wearing a hip hop shirt about 6"1 with facial hair. I told the bouncer she was clearly asking for HELP. To my surprise he pretty much brushed me away to mind my business. Another bouncer had to intervene to calm down. I explained to the bouncer I have morals and for this to happen is not right. I can't walk away from this situation and pretend like nothing is happening. God forbid this girl end up murdered and on news the next morning. If I see something wrong I speak up. This is how I was raised and hope this can be read by someone in management at this bar to know a certain employee don't care for the safety of their customers.
author: Justine M.

description: Visiting from out of town. Food was very average, server did not really care and was drinking at the bar in between serving the table..... looks like a great place for a bar. I would scrap the food and focus on being a full time bar.....or make some changes quickly. Just being honest........ hope things improve.
author: Darren F.

description:
Come here for the party atmosphere, come here to watch the big game, but skip it for the food. 
The service was mediocre at best, our waitress was highly inattentive and every step required flagging her down (it was a slow afternoon too, she was chatty with her colleagues). 

The trio of salsa (which is well reviewed here on yelp) wasn't anything special. The enchiladas were seasoned strangely, not sure the chef knows what spices go in Mexican food. 
My wife enjoyed the rolled tacos, but honestly, those are pretty tough to screw up. If you find yourself dragged here by some friends, stick to the bottled/draft drinks and rolled tacos to survive the
author: Nicholas H.

description:
I don't expect the finest and classiest of bar experiences when I hit the Marina, but damn, Sabrosa really out-sucked them all. 

I hit this place with some friends on a Friday night at around 11pm. The music sounded good (at least whatever I could hear from outside the bar during my 25 minute wait in line). Finally got in, and I danced as my friends waited another several minutes for drinks, which were literally not worth it with the amount of people bumping into you causing you to spill your drink anyway. The crowd ranges from "entitled frat boy screaming 'Don't Stop Believin'' at the top of his lungs" to "creepy man grabbing you without your consent" which of course, I don't blame the bar for, but if you're coming here you should probably keep it in mind. 

Still, all of this doesn't warrant a one star review, which brings me to my least favorite part of the night. A friend of mine had a little too much to drink, so I took him outside to get some air. The bouncer yelled at us to move out of in front of the bar and go sit on the side, and not wanting to cause trouble, we complied. Went and sat on a chair on the side, and immediately, a bar employee told approached us and screamed "Get the fuck off my chairs." I was baffled since the bouncer told us to sit here literally a minute ago. He said "No he didn't say that you need to fucking go," and not wanting to escalate the situation, I apologized and walked away from the area. He pointed at us threateningly until we reached across the street--it was literally the most extra and unnecessary thing I had experienced. My friends reported similar experiences with the bouncers/employees there, one of whom even threatened to put my friend in a headlock if he didn't leave. Like, I get that dealing with drunk people isn't fun (and I was DD so I was stone-cold sober), but when we're causing no harm to anyone else, it seems like a logical idea to treat your paying customers with at least a little respect. Needless to say, we won't be coming back. 

Oh also, make sure you have cash on you, because there is a $5 cover for this trash experience.
author: Mahima N.

description: Great venue for night life, the bar staff is top notch. Jeremy there is a great host and promotes a great time each and every trip I've made
author: Thomas W.

description: Be sure to never go to this place after 10 pm or you'll encounter the big bad bouncer with curly hair who happens to be the most misogynistic and hostile person that works there. The good news is they employ him right at the front door so you'll never miss him. I used to go to this place all the time (even though their cover charge is ridiculous) but after last night I'll never go back. I arrived with a group of friends and the bouncer was yelling at two girls in front of us to get their money out. They decided they didn't like his tone so they left. We were up next and he started telling me "what are you doing get your money out". I showed him my money and proceeded to the counter to pay. He started yelling at my friends (who I was paying for), "get your money out, how many times do you I have to say it get your money out now". I told him I didn't like the tone he was using since he wanted to give off the vibe that we were inmates and he was our CO. He put his face right up to mine and said "what did you say?" So I once again told him to tone it down and relax but he decided that I "didn't deserve to get in" and opened the line for me to leave. Not much of a threat since Jackson is a wonderful bar across the street with great music and no cover. However this isn't the first time I've seen him treat females at the bar inappropriately. The fact that he got in my face as if he was going to take some violent action towards me is unbelievable. I hope some action will be taken towards his contempt for women, social exclusion, discrimination, hostility, belittling, and violent mannerisms but I bet he'll still be employed next weekend so I'm just happy that people will be able to see my post and will choose not to go to sabrosa anymore.
author: Alyxandra R.

description: I wasn't ready for this place lol.  My wife told me that it is a restaurant that turned into a bar.  Mind you I am a bit out of the party scene, but this place reminded me of a crackin house party.  Food is more americanized.  We ordered a plate of nachos and it had chunks of juicy steak, not that cheap asada skirt steak stuff.  Other than that I was out of my comfort zone.
author: Donnie R.

description: Worse bar in SF. Went at midnight on Friday with a bunch of girlfriends. The management and security are a mess and they don't treat people well at all. They have a huge inflated ego. Don't bother coming here as you can tell from the already low rating.
author: Cina L.

description:
A bar that has happy hour every day from 4-7pm? I'm sold! I'm surprised there weren't more people here during happy hour. 

The best thing on their happy hour menu is the Sabrosa Especial. For $10 you get a beer, a tequila shot, and a taco!! I love that it comes with a taco. You can choose what kind of beer you want and which meat you want in your taco. I had the carne asada and carnitas and they were both good. I probably had at least 3 Sabrosa Especials. 

The quesadilla was also good and was served piping hot. 

I came on a Saturday afternoon and since it's not very busy you can easily get a table and service is fast. Our waiter was very patient with us even though we were probably pretty rowdy, especially after 3 rounds of the Sabrosa Especial. :)

Overall, our group had a great time here and service was great!
author: Mai Y.

description: They'll take your $40 to get in, then give you a stamp on the way out to make a phone call, and then tell you to go to the back of the line on the way back in.
author: Ethan J.

description:
Jady (our server) was 5 stars! Great Service always with a smile no matter how busy she got, checked in on us regularly, exactly what I expect from an awesome server in a great neighborhood! Marinaaaa. 

Hostess... attitude problem. Almost left with my 7+ party Smile girl ;) its gonna be ok. Ugh non welcoming. 

Food;Nachos... They would be better if they were authentic Mexican. Just not good and used not even the good fake cheese. Sorry :/
author: LJ E.

description:
Went here tonight with friends for drinks and dinner, and the food was completely underwhelming. The shrimp tacos were over-cooked, salad had no flavor, and the quesadilla was all right. If you're going to eat here, the quesadilla was the best of the bunch, but that's not saying much. 

Be sure to check in on Yelp to get a coupon for free chips and salsa, otherwise they'll charge you $6 to order it (which is blasphemy in my book). 

Waitress was a doll, props to her kindness and  excellent service!
author: Gaby L.

description: 2:30ish lunch - SHOULD HAVE CHRCKED YELP FIRST!!waitress (manager??) drinking shots with customers, found a piece of plastic in my enchilada, flat Coke, undercooked hamburger, nothing good about this experience!!
author: Melissa R.

description:
I went to Sabrosa for a friends' birthday dinner. While the atmosphere was fun, it's not a place I'd recommend for a large group because the noise level was pretty high and by the end of the meal the place felt a lot more like a Marina bar vs. nice restaurant. 

The food was good. We ordered different kinds of tacos, nachos, ceviche, quesadillas etc. Everything was cooked well and flavorful, but nothing blew me away. The margaritas were also very strong with is a nice plus. 

The meal was VERY expensive. We each spent over $60 and didn't feel like we actually had that much food. The margaritas were pricy and the tacos were really small. I'm a vegetarian and I had a hard time finding options that weren't salad. With so many great Mexican food options in SF, this wasn't a place worth rushing back to

That said, their Happy Hour deal looked pretty awesome so I'd definitely go back for that!
author: Sophie S.

description: This is the worst place I've ever been. The rudest employees. The security named Cowboy was so stuck up and rude. They lady managing the door Friday night was very disrespectful. Horrible management. They should re consider and hire better people. They hired the wrong people and security. Don't come here it's not worth your time
author: Nessa L.

description: Very good mexican restaurant in the cow hollow neighborhood. I came here for Mother's day brunch and the restaurant was not very busy. The waitress was very friendly and the tacos were tasty. I reccomend stopping by if you are in the Neighborhood and looking for Mexican food.
author: Scoot S.

description:
So I'm not going to lie, this place deserves three and a half stars. The food was alright. The inside is cool. The service could totally be better. But damn....the bartenders are hot. Yes, I said it. They have highly attractive bartenders and yes, that's a good enough reason for me spend some money after working out with my friends.

Ok, on to the things that actually matter. I've come for brunch a couple of times and I'm boring. The best bang for your buck is the tres huevos. Potatoes, eggs any style, and a choice of meat. I cannot bring myself to pay $13 USD for a bowl of soup or $14 for three tacos. I get that I'm in the city and things are expensive....which is why I'll go with the taco truck tacos in Fruitvale. Food was decent. It was fresh and my eggs were cooked perfectly. They did forget my homegirl's tacos though. Whoops! 

The bartenders are super nice as are the staff. Just seems like maybe they aren't focused? Idk how to describe it because they really are super nice and I can't hate on nice people. 

There's great patio seating on a sunny day and I have seen a few people there with their dogs for those of you with furry friends.

A few TVs and like I said...three and half stars so round up to four. ;)
author: Sierra R.

description: Disappointed in Sabrosa, we have been several times and stopped by last night to celebrate a birthday. We were repeatedly harassed by a patron and when we informed the bouncer of our situation, he told us that physical harassment was not sufficient grounds for this person to be removed, that he had to of verbally threatened us. The bouncer then condescendingly asked: "are you just trying to get him kicked out" and proceeded to catch-up with his friends nearby, ignoring our unresolved situation. As women we feel unsafe and disrespected at Sabrosa, which is thankfully uncommon in SF, and therefore will not be returning.
author: Shauna-Li W.

description:
Horrible service. I went out to eat with some friends on sat. night, and all my friends food came, i asked 3x for mine, then the waitress came by and unapologetically said, 'we forgot to put in your order and the kitchen is closed. you're not getting your food tonight'. She really didn't seem to care. I was shocked.

I've never once been to a restaurant in my life where that has happened. I'm never eating here again and I'm telling every person I know about this.
author: William W.

description: Great taco Tuesday special! $2 street tacos and $2 Tecates! Appetizers are a little pricy but are very filling.
author: Corbin S.

description: We come here every every weekend and the food is delicious! We always get the nachos and enchiladas. Fun environment and the service is great. Super fun and great food!
author: Keely A.

description: Kyle and Jaedy treated us right. That jalapeño liquor was ridiculous good. The coco nut Marc was also above all standards. They have a giant screen for warriors and I just fucking wish I lived in sf
author: Derek C.

description:
I thought this was a pretty good meal. Not the best Mexican food I've had but decent.

We started with the queso. It was fine but very bland. Almost no flavor. The trio of salsas were good. The orange-ish one was the best. They were plopped down and no one told us what they were. I had to ask our waiter when he next came by.

Then we had the shrimp platter, the carne asada platter, and the carnitas. All were good. For dessert the banana fritters. A bit too sweet but I don't think one can go wrong with a fried banana.

Nice drink selection and some good mezcals. It was SUPER loud. The club music didn't really make much sense. And the volume made it difficult for us to talk at all. It wasn't very busy at 7 pm on a Friday but maybe they were just getting ready for late night.

All in all, pretty good. The service was fine. Not the most attentive but okay. Our waiter was very pleasant. We'd come back for sure.
author: Karen N.

description: Good place to go out to at night. But brunch is absolutely horrible! We did have the nicest waitress but the food and drinks took too long to come out. And the food was mediocre. I hope they change how they organize things because this place has a lot of potential, but I was not impressed
author: Grace M.

description:
Came here for a birthday and received HORRIBLE service. We asked our server at least 3x to order food but he wouldn't. Finally, he was ready for the food to be ordered. We didn't receive our food until all the other people in our group were done eating. 
The worst was they didn't let us finish eating and pushed us off the table. Horrible service. Overrated. I will not be coming back here
author: Deepika G.

description: Been wanting to write this but was unsure of how. A few weeks ago, 2 friends and I went to the first thursdays event at this bar. We ordered drinks (vodka with mixers), and within minutes of sipping, we were incoherently drunk, blacked out, and sick. Barely even got half way through the drink before feeling that way. So what the hell was in them? Not trying to make any accusations but I do want to talk to a manager, just letting them know that this did happen to us at their establishment. We feel like we may have been roofied, or drugged with something. It was just the strangest, quickest reaction to a drink any of us had had. I mean within 2 minutes had to leave because we were so sick and wobbly and felt awful. People watch out for your drinks in the marina! This happens all the time out there.
author: Elise F.

description: The food was amazing, really big difference from last time I was here. The steak and eggs blew my mind!
author: Stacy R.

description: I left this establishment to go get my sister who had just got into town from Portland. I came back with her about 3 minutes later. My card was behind the  bar (because I had already been there) he would not let either of is in. Big mistake on their part. We ending up spending hundreds of dollars across the street. Tip: fire your door men; they are TERRIBLE!
author: Stephanie N.

description: We almost left after just drinks without ordering, unfortunately we stayed. Every dish and appetizer came out cold. Cold queso is not my thing. Then we were given the wrong orders. When I send it back and said I did not want the meal anymore she acted like the manager was doing me a favor by not charging me. No, you're not having to make another meal since you made the first order incorrect so you're saving too. My partner's meal was wrong as well but he just ate it. This place used to have a bigger menu and was good. Not sure what happened here but it is awful tonight. The staff was not attentive and just standing around. Never returning.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I tried this place with a few friends since we knew happy hour was going on (4pm-7pm). This place has a very nice set up and I was a big fan of the music selection. I definitely feel this place is definitely for a younger crowd with the music selection but there were older people who were loving it just as well. 

Their happy hour menu is great, a nice selection of food and drinks so I definitely suggest going during those times. I was able to order directly from that menu and was full. I got the chicken quesadillas which were alright. They were filling but nothing special. The waitresses were really nice too. They were actually attentive and had suggestions which always makes it seem like they enjoy their job. 

Great place for gathering with friends and happy hour is a great time to be there.
author: William W.

description:
Atmosphere: Hopping, energetic, lively and loud
Host: able to squeeze us in without a reservation THANK YOU!
Server: Personable, appropriately attentive, deserved the good tip she got.
Food: Inventive salsas, carnitas cooked perfectly, complex flavor profiles for Mexican cuisine, fresh ingredients, taco salad layered nicely.  
Comments: The chef here takes this style of cuisine into a place where flavors are subtle and bold at the same time...quite a feat.  We will definitely come back.
CONGRATULATIONS, SABROSA!
author: Guy Q.

description: Great dancing on a saturday night. And has quite an interesting aura for the marina district
author: Eli S.

description:
I can really only comment on the drinks, but I think I have another favorite SF bar.

I somehow meandered into Sabrosa after spending some time at Jaxon's, the bar across the street.

Sabrosa had a few customers, but it was not crowded or loud; the decor was pleasant with a spacious layout. 

I found a nice pair of bar seats and was immediately greeted and  presented with a drink menu (+1 in my mind).  There were several spirits that I have never heard of before so I just asked the bartender, Adrian, for Sabrosa's or his specialty drink.  Moments later, I was presented with the Macho, a salt rimmed fiery drink made with just the right amount of jalapeño.  For those who understand, it burned so good... 

I chatted with Adrian a couple times, not only was he friendly (providing my friend and I both a cup of water along with our first drink), he was also quite knowledgeable about the drinks on the menu-- he even knew the history and shared some trivia about the spirits used.  For me, this speaks volumes to the quality of the bar.

This is a great place to wind down before calling it a night.

Without a doubt, I am a fan and will be back to try the food (the guac looks amazing), and of course more of the booze as well.
author: Mike L.

description:
I really want to like this place but every time I go the staff is just rude.
The service is horrible in every possible way.
author: J d.

description:
Shitty bar, shitty drinks, shitty employees.                  I unfortunately stumbled upon this horrendous establishment this weekend. There was an unreasonable cover charge and aggressive bouncer out front. Beyond the door was a bar that was overpacked and grimy, with a sub par DJ. The drinks were watered down and overpriced with disrespectful bartenders that would refuse to acknowledge the guys in our party. I wish this is where it ended BUT it only got worse!!

Leaving the bar, I witnessed a scene that was not only disgusting but illegal! A young, petite girl was leaving the bar and arguing with the 6'3" husky bartender about him taking a strangers ID. He then proceeded to grab the girl violently and attempted to shove her forward (wouldn't be surprised if she had a bruised wrist) to which she demanded he stop grabbing her and he continued. He was clearly harassing her and using his large frame to dominate rather than his intelligence, since the girl pointed out that he couldn't take a strangers legal ID away. It is in fact ILLEGAL for a bouncer to confiscate an ID (only police can) and this was as they were leaving the bar. The girl turned and asked to speak to the manager, but the aggressive bouncer continued to push the girl and the guy asking for his ID back, saying "No, get out." This was clearly out of line and proof that this business hires aggressive, unintelligent, sexist, and unlawful employees. I am repulsed and will never return, hopefully they are shut down for committing  crimes and I hope that the girl filed a report against this horrible man and the bar!!!
author: Sophia P.

description:
Came here back in March after too many bottomless mimosas for what I like calling lunner (late lunch, early dinner). Needing some food to soak up all the bubbly, a gf and I stumbled in and ordered the following:

Flautas del Mercado ($8) - Crispy rolled home made tortillas with free range chicken & potato, guajillo chili-beans crema & cotija cheese. I remember them being hard, dry and tasteless. The tortilla was really thick which I wasn't a fan of.

Short ribs con mole ($18) - Slow roasted carnitas, veracruzan xico mole, organic sweet potatoes & rice. Ribs were not tender and moist. Again this was dry and kind of flavorless. Even with the sauce. And the rice wasn't very good either. The sweet potatoes didn't mix well with it at all.

So our lunner was kind of a fail. Very unsatisfying. But our server was nice and we had a good time, despite the disappointing food.
author: Elena N.

description: Spent money inside the bar. Stepped outside for a minute and they tried to make me wait in line again. Am I not already a customer at that point? I've never seen this before at a bar and will never go again. I will say the music was good but that doesn't make up for the bad manager who thought he was the best thing since sliced bread
author: Jags B.

description: with new management taking over the kitchen sabrosa has made a huge turn around ! mouth watering food and drinks and the quality of the ingredients they use really makes a difference . so much love put into everything  you will not be sorry you came here !!
author: Gypsy E.

description: Cowboy is the most racist most discriminating person EVERRR!!!!! Me and my gfs waited in line for such a long time and he STILL didnt let us in!!! Like whyyy?!!! What did we do but wait in line and try and get in???
author: Pani S.

description:
We went here looking for a great time on a Saturday night after dinner! My counter parts and I are ~ 30 y.o plus or minus. 
My SO and I moved here about 3 years ago from Arizona. We never got our CA license as its never been a problem. 
Anyways short story is, bouncer carded my SO 1145pm, took his license away and said it was fake. We waited ~ 10 min for him to "call the cops" as I recommended the bouncer to do as my SO does needs to drive almost daily and I have the same ID anyways. He came out finally and said "my manager won't accept this". We left. Thankfully we got a his legal form of ID back. Anyways- get more knowledgeable staff and/or get black light to check how "real" a real ID is. Also didn't look good 7 people waiting outside a bar because they wouldn't let one person in,  whom is YEARS over 21. Your bad.
author: Alexandria L.

description:
I was thrilled when a new mexican restaurant Sabrosa opened in early 2014 in the Marina district of San Francisco. Not only because I'm a huge Mexican food lover (so much that I started a Mexican Dinner Club, M.D.C.) but also since after my first visit I saw what a great Bar Sabrosa has. The bar alone takes up about 1/3 of the restaurant and has a great vibe and scene for drinks or light bites.  There's something about a great over sized bar in a restaurant that I like that excites me. Probably since I know I'll frequent the restaurant that much more often to have a drink or two at the bar. Sure enough, a week after visiting  Sabrosa for dinner I was back for a Friday Happy Hour with a friend. The Happy Hour was great, special drink and food deals with a great scene at reasonable happy hour prices! 3200 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94123. (415) 638-6500.

Thanks for checking out my post I hope you enjoy dining with The JetSetting Fashionista. Emily
author: JetSettingFashionista J.

description:
Loud. Fun. Happy.
Great bloody mary with bacon.
Enjoyed the Sabrasa salad with carne asada. Meat was awesome and salad was unpretentious.  I did leave with a headache from the loudness.
Service slow.  We had to flag down someone for service.  It seem like the waitress forgot to serve our food.
author: Lisa L.

description: I always go to Sabrosa for the great tacos and a good Sunday Funday. Although the food is good, the wait staff is always extremely rude and not friendly. Today, Stacey was our waitress and gave us subpar service coupled with a horrible/rude attitude. She rolled her eyes at customers, told another lady to "Move, get out of my way!", and said "mother f***ers" about us when we asked to speak to a manager. Even though the food is good, I question whether it is worth coming here.
author: Sam M.

description:
After leaving another bar - we noticed that this place was pretty empty on a Saturday night which is rare considering it's the marina. The east west bar on the opposite side was jam packed so we decided to stop in this place. We show up - and the bouncer grabbed my ID in a forceful manner. It's. A legitimate drivers license (I'm 26) and he kept insisting it was "a fake" and kept my ID. I told him to call the cops if he's so confident - he decided to go to his manager. He came back 10 minutes later and said "we can't accept your ID" so he knew it was legit but couldn't man up to being wrong. I got
it back finally but don't go here if you "look" young. Plenty of other place is the Marina to have fun - this place isn't.
author: Alec S.

description:
Delicious, fresh, well-presented and well-proportioned food. At the moment, the best part is it's not too popular yet to have a crazy wait at brunch. It was easy to make a reservation, and at noon on a Saturday we could easily have gone without one (and had our pick of any table inside. Luckily a table opened outside). When we left around 2pm it was much more full but there still didn't look to be a wait.

SERVICE: Great, chill, did everything right.

COST: $33 total (incl. tax/tip) for 1 drink and 1 brunch entree. On the pricey side.

MUST-HAVES: The Macho! (a Margarita)

SABROSA MARGARITAS
Menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sabrosa-san-francisco?select=7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ#pObBD3OYhfhVNFQPXXWkLw
* Macho (mezcal, lime, agave, roasted jalapeno. $13) - 5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sabrosa-san-francisco?select=7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ#txIKtMREQXaowvBhCC0EKQ
We both loved this. Perfect balance of smoky, spicy, sweet, and salty. Great brunch drink, would be a great nighttime drink as well.

BRUNCH: APERITIVOS & ANTOJITOS
Menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sabrosa-san-francisco?select=7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ#7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ
* Fideo Seco con Camarón y Huevo (angel hair pasta, chile sauce, shrimp, egg, avocado, cotija cheese. $12) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sabrosa-san-francisco?select=7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ#62HCnSJy82GwYl1Aril-5g
Very tasty, and though my mind was confused as to whether I was having brunch, Mexican, Italian, or Seafood, it loved the combination of it all. The shrimp was really fresh and had that awesome crunch when I bit into it, and the angel hair and sauce was perfectly proportioned and cooked just soft enough (i.e. not too el dente).

* Chilaquiles Rojos con Frijol y Huevo ($13) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sabrosa-san-francisco?select=7Xe9Ku_Q0pBr_s1nHUJEDQ#SJasNEftpW2A_kaE1yY6Vw
Tried a bite of my friend's and was as big of a fan as he was. Really tasty, the tortilla chips were coated just enough to have a great layer of flavor, be slightly soggy, yet still have a crunch. Awesome with the eggs, pinquito beans, and cheese.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Was standing outside this restaurant on a Friday night (clearly this place gets busy as it turns into a dance club at night) with a plastic glass of water minding my own business and the bouncer came up to me and said "we do not allow this in front of our establishment" as if I was doing something illegal. He had the audacity to take the cup out of my hand and throw it on the street. Not an ounce of decency. Extremely disrespectful. It baffles me that they hire folks who think they can act this way with someone standing on public property (sidewalk).
author: Namitha K.

description:
2 stars, but giving 3 because it was a bday and it was fun just because of that. 
$14 for 3 MINI tacos?? :(
Awful margarita ?? Can't remember which one sorry :(
On the plus side, our waitress was great and did her best trying to split up our bill.. 
Drinks took foreverrrrr to come out, I even read reviews thinking "these people are complainers, how can it be THAT slow??" ... Well it was, lol.
They weren't too busy, either.
All in all, not bad. Might go back if I'm asked to. Won't go on my own.
author: Alyssa H.

description: On Friday and Saturday night, great place to go to get drinks and dance/hangout with friends. Although line can sometimes be kind of long, I recommend popping in for a drink.
author: Leslie K.

description:
Shitty managers, shitty service, shitty food, shitty drinks. Don't ever come here. On top of all of this I was sexual harassed by the bouncer and then told it was my fault and that I had to leave. This place does not care about its customers and its reputation with me the past few times I've been here has continued to go down the drain. Will not be giving my time to the people here anymore and I hope they take care of their bouncer so no other girls have to go through what I did 
 other night.
author: Juliana C.

description: I have NEVER been treated so awful. I walked in on a Saturday night and used the restroom first. While waiting in a very long line I realized other customers were already intoxicated and rude. I finally went in a stall and a male employee who worked there opened the stall door ( I locked the door so I don't know how he got in-a key?). Seeing I was in there he continued to open the door and asked me to get out staring at me. I asked if I could grab my coat and purse from the back of the door and he accused me of doing blow in their bathrooms with ZERO president as a 32 year old mature adult who had been in there for 45 seconds. I was so offended that he told me he was going to kick me out. My boyfriend came out of the stall next to me and proceeded to argue. After which two 22 year old girls walked into a stall together (probably to do blow) and he said nothing! I have never been so offended I didn't even wash my hands and left the bar before ordering a drink in tears. Will NEVER come here again and will tell all of my female friends to avoid it at all costs.
author: Cassie W.

description: If I could give less stars I absolutely would. I waited in line for thirty to forty five minutes and was found to be denied by the bouncer for my "fake ID" even though I am 24 years old. I have never been treated with such disrespect and shame. I have given this bar/restaurant so much business and I am ashamed with the disrespect and inappropriateness I was treated with. This left a really bad taste in my mouth and I definitely will not be coming back. Change your bouncers, get some scanners and if you're going to say an ID is fake be legitimate about it. Thanks.
author: McKenzie C.

description:
Sabrosa was pretty underwhelming, overall a disappointment.  I'll cut them some slack because they are relatively new but some aspects of the experience were just unacceptable.

The food was ok.  We started with the guacamole and as far as those go, it was good but not great.  Nice touch with the pomegranates but didn't make it exceptional.  The quesadilla de tinge poblano was ok as well, nothing epic.  So far just average, right? Well what took it well below par was my entree: the spice-rubbed, blackened rib-eye. It was definitely rubbed and blackened but unfortunately they forgot to cook it. At all.  The ribeye is a marbled cut and it's flavor comes from cooking the fat itself, perfect at medium-rare but terrible rare.  Rare is what I got, white fat with bloody red meat, I had to send it back.  Inspecting the steak, the waitress felt terrible and they tried to make up for it but the steak came back over-cooked.  Without us asking, they comp'd the entree which was nice of them but didn't take away from the overall disappointment of the meal.

Service was fine, they were busy and left us stranded a couple of times but overall ok.  Decor was decent, pretty familiar array of banquet-style communal tables with booths and traditional tables against a modern, low-lit backdrop.  It was incredibly loud, think night club-level but that was fine.

Hope they get their shit together in the coming months, place has potential but was definitely a #fail for us.
author: Saminda W.

description: We love Sabrossa! Kyle behind the bar is great! All food is fantastic! Brussel sprouts a must!
author: Robin F.

description:
I give this establishment one star with no apologies. 

Came here on a Saturday for brunch & the Warriors game with some friends who live in the marina and the place was shockingly dead. I asked my friend what was up with an empty brunch spot on a weekend in the city..she said it's always empty and she's still trying to figure it out. The answer??? THE SERVICE. 

Our server did the absolute minimum and was very inattentive the entire time. We ordered our food + chips and guac (another mystery solved: why are chips and guac priced at $9? Because they give you 9 chips) And waited for a very. Long. Time. Finally we asked if we could get our chips us at least. She brought them and our food came shortly after. Huevos rancheros were decent but nothing to shout about. Also the guacamole was bland so we added salt and Tapatio. 

It was the opening game for the NBA playoffs and Sabrosa has advertised this on their chalkboard outside so we thought it would be a great place to watch. The game was playing on the tvs but no sound. We asked our server if we could have sound for the game and she gave us a strange look (you advertised this place as a watch spot so???) and said "oof, I will ask, but I don't think he will say yes" (referring to the grumpy bartender) she asked him right in front of us and he replied no (??????) (As you may be beginning to realize his was a very confusing experience for me) so we went without sound until a few min before tip off when I guess the bartender had a change of heart. 

Good thing he did because the game drew a crowd which was nice. We continued to watch while getting minimal service.

One star. Employees need training on customer service () and food was mediocre.
author: Caroline D.

description: One of my favorite meals while visiting Cow Hollow used to be a great bowl of chicken soup from Sabrosa's. No more. Rather than a clear brother with crunchy veggies with shredded chicken it now seems they are serving the enchilada sauce.
author: M Sheila R.

description:
We came here during happy hour. The food is still overpriced and uninspired. Nothing has any real flavor.

And the service is awful. The place was nearly empty, yet our server was often in the back, and unavailable to take drink or food orders. When she did finally take an order, drinks and food took a very long time to be delivered.

I mentioned before that their prices are too high, so we tried happy hour. It's still overpriced for the quality of the food. A tiny $5 taco on the happy hour menu (vs. $8 on the regular menu) is outrageous, but then when it is tasteless, that is just insulting.

To make matters worse, the waitress "accidentally" charged full prices on multiple happy hour items. When we asked her, she didn't apologize, but acted like that is her standard practice to see if she can get away with it. Questionable behavior.

No one from our group of 6 will ever come back. Prices too high, poor service, and questionable overcharging tactics make this place a pass. It's probably why the place is usually empty.
author: Mary W.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Saturday for brunch as a group of 6. Three of them arrived about half an hour early which also happened to be half an hour before the place even opened. Our server was still kind enough to open the doors early and let them sit while they waited for us.

We chatted for a while after arriving before actually ordering. I got a Grenada (pomegranate soda) and something (couldn't pronounce the name then so I definitely can't remember the name now) that was fried pasta topped with shrimp, avocado, an egg, and some cheese crumbles. The soda was okay, normal house soda I suppose. The fried pasta was actually a nice touch and really good. I finished it all. Considering the place was pretty slow for the first part, service and the food came out pretty slow. Our waitress was very friendly though! We sat for a while after eating and our waitress was chill about it.

Overall it was a decent brunch, if not a little pricey and slow.
author: Kat C.

description: Sabrosas suck. The bouncers are incredibly rude and dont know how to read an ID. They wouldn't take our real washington ID. Then, they cuss at you when you ask why they think it's not real. It's 100% real and the bouncers were being incredibly rude to everyone around. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Mediocre place with incredibly rude and highly unprofessional staff.
author: Ilse C.

description:
This review is only for the bar. We went here with a group on Saturday night rather early, maybe around 7:30. We found a spot at the bar all the way to the left and tried to order drinks. That is when I met the rudest bartender of all times. She not once smiled at us, she literally made it so uncomfortable for our entire group ( and mind you there was a lot of us which means more money for her). She was so nasty to us but when another bartender would come by and grab her and throw her in the air she was giggling and laughing and smiling. We had to wave another bartender down to get the rest of our drink orders and ice in my drink she didn't finish. If you don't want to be behind the bar and your only intention is to try and sleep with your coworkers then you should probably not work in customer service. 

Beyond that I would like to come back and try the food. The place looks nice and seems to have a good vibe, they just need to put their employees in check.
author: Jessica S.

description:
My wife and I live a couple of blocks away from the triangle and tried out Sabrosa when it first opened and thought it was terrible. Service was good, but the food wasn't.  On a whim, we decided to try it again a few Monday's ago for happy hour and it was awesome.

Their happy hour is from 4-7, which is a plus in itself, but the menu has changed and they have some pretty good items now and the happy hour prices are great.  Our favorite item is the mole quesadilla and it's amazing.  The other items on the HH menu are really good as well.

Sarah, the bartender there is great and we've been back every week.  Definitely recommend checking them out again as they are working hard to get the locals back though the doors and they are even showing Dubs games on the old City Tavern projection screen again...
author: Josh B.

description:
No idea what the food and drinks are like.  I do know how difficult it is to organize a dinner for 10 close friends.  I do know Sabrosa did not honor our reservations made weeks ahead; I know Sabrosa did not contact us to cancel our reservation; and they have a very unhelpful staff.
If you are planning a special event, don't come here, it can ruin your day.
author: Glo Y.

description:
We came here during happy hour. The food is overpriced and uninspired. Nothing has any real flavor.

The service is awful. The place was nearly empty, yet our server was often in the back, and unavailable to take drink or food orders. When she did finally take an order, drinks and food took a very long time to be delivered.

I mentioned before that their prices are too high, so we tried happy hour. It's still overpriced for the quality of the food. A tiny $5 taco on the happy hour menu (vs. $8 on the regular menu) is outrageous, but then when it is tasteless, that is just insulting.

To make matters worse, the waitress "accidentally" charged full prices on multiple happy hour items. When we asked her, she didn't apologize, but acted like that is her standard practice to see if she can get away with it. Questionable behavior.

No one from our group of 6 will ever come back. Prices too high, poor service, and questionable overcharging tactics make this place a pass. It's probably why the place is usually empty.
author: S H.

description: The atmosphere is very fun, lots of people around but the service is sub par. Waited over 20 min for our drink order and then over 30 min for our food order to be placed. The bar seems well stocked but not a good sit down place.
author: M K.

description: DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU ARE GIRL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!i. I am not from here, but as someone who tries to make the most of life, I cannot let this slide. The bouncers act like they are gods and pass  judgement as such. (I'll get to a specific reason in a second) If you are trying to have a good night, douche bag free; avoid this bar!! Management is clearly none existent here! If you feel like spending 45 minutes to an hour and a half  inline only to be told that you are not allowed in(for no reason) then have fun. By the way I look like, and that includes my 6 friends too, any normal college student. We all went to School together and graduated in 2013. We caused no ruckus or complaints, but were simple denied entry despite proof of other  iD(including a passport!) I don't no about you but I would rather spend my time and money somewhere that won't profile me or my friends.
author: Grace F.

description: Cool, fun place in the marina.  Had some delicious tacos with friends and a delicious salad.  Waitress was great with service and their selection of  wine was good.  I'll be back; fun place to mingle and meet locals in the marina.  They have a DJ Fri and Sat nights.  The owner has a cross displayed on the wall which I thought was terrific way to openly show your love for your faith... at your business.  Wish you continued success.
author: Neveen B.

description: I didn't get a chance to try the food here, since I already ate. I came here with a small group for drinks on a Friday night. Our table had the pleasure of being helped by Shawn...at least I think that was his name. Very attentive young man. Suggestive, helpful...just an awesome person. Got our drinks on a timely basis and frequently checked up on us. I obviously had a great night, since I can't even seem to remember the drinks I got...but I do remember them being good! Will be back to visit this place
author: Michael C.

description: I've walked by Sabrina many times and it always looks like a good time with music blasting out the windows. Decided to check it out for some brunch and Sunday football. Ordered the breakfast burrito and it was really bland. You could tell there was no seasoning added. Sabrosa is good for football and drinks but I'll pass on the food.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The only reason I am giving this place a 2 star instead of the 1 star is because the food was actually pretty tasty, but everything else about this restaurant was pretty terrible. 

The inside is very loud and noisy and they play the music pretty loud, causing you the need to talk over if you want to have a conversation. Hey, if your into that sort of thing then do it. But that is not why I am rating this so low. 

Showed up around 12:30 on a Sunday morning, it looks like the brunch crowd was just starting to leave, but they were at about 75% capacity. We sat down and after we ordered drinks it took way longer for my beer to be brought to me than it should have. 

Once our waitress finally took our order it must have been around 12:50. Our food came out at 1:18. 30 minutes to prepare a breakfast burrito is ludacris!!! The worst part is the waitress did not come and check on us while we were waiting to let us know the food is going to take a while. 

Then when the burrito finally arrived, as soon as I picked it up, it fell apart all over the plate. It tasted pretty good (hence my 2 star review). Then to top it all of the waitress never came over and asked how the meal was and if I needed anything else. 

I want to give them the benefit of the doubt that they were understaffed that morning, and I am willing to return to try it again. But being understaffed is not an excuse, that/s the job of management to accurately forecast demand. Even being short staffed the lack of care and service from the waitress and the kitchen was pretty awful.
author: NinjaJeff S.

description: Pretty fun bar on a Friday night if you don't mind being sexually harassed by a bar tender and pushed around by the bouncer on a power trip. Aside from a couple nightmare staff members, a fine spot on the weekend.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
I'm conflicted between - 2 and 3 for this place, but just based on the bar(I'll have to come back to try the food). Came here with some friends to grab a drink and from the second we walked in, the bartender-Jenna, was so incredibly rude. It was loud in the bar and we couldn't hear what she was asking and she was annoyed by that. Instead of leaning closer and putting a smile on, like good customer service should do, she called another bartender over to complain to... Instead of pouring our drinks. 

The other servers and bartenders were really great and nice. There was another bartender (the one not flirting and massaging Jenna) that came over and completed our orders and he was super personable and fun. 

The drinks were good and interesting, but a little over priced for the size. I think if the bartender had been a little more inviting, I would have given this place more stars, but she made us so uncomfortable that we couldn't even finish our drinks because we wanted to leave so bad.
author: Sarah E.

description:
On a first glance this place looks like it has potential. Unfortunately, on quality, it did not live up to its looks.

I started with Guacamole and chips as a measuring stick. The guac was... Bland and they threw in a considerable amount of red and green bell pepper landmines on it. Imagine the effect that marshmellows have on lucky charms... But reverse it.
 
If the guacomole and chips are bad in a mexican restaurant, usually the rest of the food is. They found a way to make carne asada not tasty. In general the food here, in terms of presentation and ingredients, is non-traditional... Which can be succesful sometimes, but in this case, it wasn't.

I gave Sabrosa 1 star for its ambiance, and another one for the benefit of the doubt.
author: Pablo J.

description: Ceviche is outstanding, like really fresh and delicious. Their entrees are alright, enchiladas are good but not like 12 something dollars good . Good and friendly service
author: Lauren V.

description: Ugh I really wish I could say good things. The security lead named Carlos is an absolute prick!! My girlfriend was dancing with a guy that was celebrating his 30th and he came out of nowhere and broke it up, in an extremely rude way. The space is big and drinks are fine but not worth hanging at a spot that disrespects women and is just rude in general
author: Sofia M.

description:
Would generally rate Sabrosa 3.5 Stars for a regular dine-in experience, however, their Happy Hour is worthy of 4 full stars. From 4-7PM, you can get a multitude of things for a highly discounted rate. We opted for the Chicken Salad ($10), 3 Tortillas ($7), Trio of Salsa with Chips ($4) and Guac with Chips ($7). They also have sangrias/wine for $7 and their wine bottles were HALF off!

We split a $50 bottle that was only $25 during HH..what a bargain for a group of four friends! We highly enjoyed all the shared plates as well.

The ambiance is trendy and upscale/contemporary. Lots of young 20-somethings and 30-somethings obviously from the Marina. A fun spot with friends or for a chill date spot.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco for  a week for work and to hang out with my cousins. This place was close to our home hence we decided to check this place out for brunch. The place had a good vibe and ambience. Between the three of us, we ordered a drink each and an entree. The drinks were really good but the food was average. I had ordered Huevos Rancheros de Carnitas- which was pork with beans and eggs. However, my dish had very few pieces of pork and more beans actually!! My cousins enjoyed their quesadilla and breakfast burrito. 
I don't think I will be visiting this place again for food. However, I will definitely come back for drinks during evening to enjoy the ambience.
author: Devanjali L.
