description: Terrible service. The waitress told us it wasn't her job to figure out our check. Food was good, but service was absolutely terrible. Management was taking shots in the background.
author: Abhishek C.

description: Good food but very rude servers. Stacey was extremely rude and unprofessional. Can't believe how much she sassed us and never smiled once. Management should really consider whether having such rude employees is good for business. I hope to hear they've hired new people but until then I will take my business elsewhere.
author: S M.

description:
Had a large group and they took reservations pretty much the only positive. Food was below average Mexican food. NOT kid friendly. I called and asked if they could provide a high chair during our lunch and they said of course no problem. They probably should have mentioned at that moment that they often turn the music up so loud that even adults need to cover their ears and is not a suitable place for children. I was looking for a lunch restaurant and this was clearly a bar that happens to serve food. Guess it is partially my fault for not researching this place heavily in advance 

Also they accidentally gave appetizers to our table we told them it wasn't ours and even after a few of us accidentally took chips they picked it up and gave it to another table. Pretty sure that's a health code violation but I'm not sure. It was weird nonetheless
author: Shawn P.

description:
Nice restaurant will clean colors and roomy design.

Was quiet at 3pm on a Saturday afternoon, after my friend, my son and I wasted over 2 hours at the Japantown Ramen disorganized event, ending in no food what so ever but a great workout walking around.

Anyway, back to Sabrosa and their fancy Mexican/South American food.

Tacos - Cochinita and Pescado were both delicious.  Grilled fish is not my choice when it comes to tacos, but hey this ain't the hardcore place where I can get cabeza or buche right?  But the grilled fish was moist, mango/fruit salsa gave the sweetness to produce some umami when a good amount of lime was squeezed on.  The pork was well marinated and had great flavors as well.

$42 for a small pitcher of Don Julio margarita may be a bit pricey but "yo you're in the Marina dude, it's all good, just pop those collars".  We had two as it was super freshly made, it definitely didn't taste like those syrupy store bought kind.  It was very clean, basic lemon with a hint of sweetness only.  Awesome!

The guacamole could of used more lime, salt and pepper but smooth and creamy anyway.

Enchiladas with mashed potatos...had an non-spicy green sauce of something I forgot, tomatillo?  But I just have one word in my head when sharing one of the three enchiladas, CARBS and yummy carbs.

Ceviche de Aquachile, real deal ceviche where all the seafood is raw and they use lime to marinate and cook.  Therefore, shrimp you can see is half raw.  Heavy amounts of lime juice which is good and seasoned very well.

Roasted corn with ricotta?...on the side was refreshing.

Trio of salsa, two were very spicy, I like.

Homemade chips everywhere from our dishes.

Great service from Anna.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Great place!
Was walking thru the Marina District and found this gem. Had the pescado it was excellent. The guacamole was the best I ever had in California. 
The decor was perfect for San Francisco. 
Anna the server was very nice. 
Ignore the so-so reviews on this place. Try it you will like it
author: Rande J.

description: Sabrosa accommodated our large group for a late brunch and we're very accommodating when we wanted to add people to our table. I had the brunch burger and it was fantastic - heard nothing but great things from our other friends on the avocado Benedict, nachos and margaritas. Can't wait to come back for another brunch!
author: Paul N.

description:
I went here during the happy hour. The food was excellent and the service was even better. The bartender, Sarah was top notch. Great to talk to and on point with her service, I left very impressed. 

While I was there I had the chicken cassadilla(wrong spelling I'm sure), rolled tacos, and wings. They were all good, but the wings were the best. I highly recommend this place if you want a good happy hour with great service. I will definitely go back.
author: James P.

description:
It's more of a bar than it is a place to eat. I went with my parents, husband, and friend. We used the check-in offer and got the free salsa trio. The salsas were not good so I am really glad we didn't pay for them. We also ordered the guac and chips as an appetzer but the guac tasted like it came from a prepackaged container with nothing added. I wasn't a fan.  I ordered the enchiladas with the verde sauce which was actually pretty good. My mom got the veggie quesadillas which she she enjoyed as well. Everyone else was not a fan of their meal. They did, however, make very strong margaritas which was a plus. 

The waitress was awful. It was like she didn't want to give us the time of day since we weren't typical Marina dudes. The place wasn't even crowded -- it was 5:30pm on a Saturday.  

Overall, it wasn't a horrible experience but I won't be going back.
author: Thea M.

description: The only thing I found edible were the wings. I was served rotten salsa. It was fermenting and even bubbling in the bowl. Disgusting.
author: Jessica G.

description: Very disappointing. While the space is great, the food and service was sub par. Supermarket guacamole for $13, what!? Plus my green chile hamburguesa had no green chillis on it! Waitress explained there were some new staffers responsible for the mix up, but didn't offer anything to rectify the situation (well, except a scoop of chillis after my half eaten burger was already cold.)
author: Hope M.

description: Not bad! But not crazy good either. Just your run of the mill, upscale Mexican spot. It took us a while to get waited on at first since we took a spot outside and the portions were pretty small for the money we paid (especially their pitchers of drinks seemed small). Their soup is good and I had the taquitos and those weren't bad either. I probably won't be back on my own accord but I would done here again with a group.
author: Erica V.

description: Went for Brunch with friends. They took a large reservation and wasn't too crowded but it was still very loud and hard to hear each other, there were TVs for watching sports if you're into that kind of thing, we were not.
author: Jamie K.

description:
Came here with a galpal who lives in the Marina area, where I use to live at one point, so know the area as well. 

The place was tre chic, but nothing super impressive. Our waiting was somewhat attentive, but couldn't speak much english, so we had to have the hostess come by to help us out. That was a fail one for this restaurant.

We ordered a pitcher of white sangria. It was nothing exciting, and didn't have much liquor. Which was a downer for the price we paid $30. I would say order one of their fun intriguing drinks, which I have done when I came here on my "Sunday Funday" happy hour hop in the fab Marina. 

As for food, my friend got the kabob trio, which she enjoyed. It was okay said, nothing exciting. I got the fish tacos, the fish was good, but there was not much filling to it, just some veggies and a litte slices of grilled pineapples. I got their salad with goat cheese, not too shabby. 

All in all, an okay place grab dinner if you are in this area of SF and looking for a decent place to eat. I wouldn't come back for dinner, but I would open to come back for a HH and try their brunch, as some here say that is good. 

Munch on!
author: Sonia A.

description:
I've tried Sabrosa for Taco Tuesday months ago: there are several big tables so all 6 of us could fit in. The service was fast and friendly, tacos came out really good!!!
I came there the other Sunday and Sabrosa proved to be amazing again. We had salads which are coming big and the ingredients are quite creative. Outside seating is a plus:)
There is a huge screen to watch a game, but I want to point out that the music there is really good, so whoever picks up the songs, you guys are doing a great job:)
author: Katie K.

description:
Me encanta el Ceviche.....Translation...Ceviche, oh hello delicious.

This place is new, but the kitchen has it going on. Cant wait to return for dinner. Originally we stopped in for a cocktail birthday celebration, which the drinks were great as well. But we decided to do a few apps and the ceviche did not disappoint.

Location...Marina central, sexy, soft, fun. Its a great date spot. Good drinks, good food, good vibes. 

See you soon.... Sabrosa ;)
author: Priscilla N.

description: It's shocking how hit and miss this place is. Fajitas rocked, top 5 ever. The burrito tasted like boiled water with little to no flavor and the 3 salsa chip dish was 3 of the worst salsa I've ever tasted.
author: Andris S.

description:
When this place first opened, it was a taste sensation. Now it's average at best. Even the fundamentals, like salsa, miss the mark. Flavorless. Steak tacos marked by grizzly, chewy pieces. Margaritas and chips are good.

What's going on here? Have you folks given up?
author: Kirsten Z.

description:
Very impressed with this place. Not missing whatsoever the previous occupant (which in Harry Potter fashion shall not be named).

The ceviche was very good, just the right spice. The tacos were also very very good. chips and guac too.

Drinks were delicious (several very good margarita variations) and naturally, a tecate in a can for watching the game on the tv is only $3.
author: Mike V.

description:
Nice outdoor seating on a tree shaded street. The sopa de pollo was really really salty. I also had a hamburger- very tasty with sautéed onions and aoli. Margs were tasty and service was prompt- our waitress kept checking to ensure we were ok with drinks which was clutch. 

Overall pleasant experience. Ambiance nice and relaxed, drinks good, food decent if overpriced ($13 for a soup is pretty steep).
author: Kristen M.

description:
My friends and I came here at night as an alternative to Eastside West and Matrix. The club itself eventually became packed and there was enough space to move around, I would definitely recommend it for its music and crowd. 

The one small complaint I have is the restroom situation, definitely need more to accommodate a big crowd. The big complaint I have is the security at the door. When we approached the door, the club was definitely halfway empty but the doorman stood there with this "tough look" and made us stand outside for no particular reason. The line grew longer and everybody looked at each other dumbfounded. We all came to the conclusion that the doorman had nothing else to make himself better about other than to look tough and act important. There was literally no reason to keep everyone outside when the place was halfway empty.
author: Gino E.

description:
1 star for the friendly service and 1 star for the chilaquiles. Otherwise, this brunch experience was bizarre and disappointing. 

The Weird:
Place was empty when we arrived at noon on a Saturday which was strange for a town that loves brunch. It became a little busier as we were there, but they hadn't printed nearly enough menus for even their small amount of patrons. I saw the staff apologizing to people seated near us but what's especially weird is that the staff was hanging out doing nothing when we arrived, with plenty of time to prepare menus. 

The Weird/Bad:
It was a cold rainy day here in SF and they opened up the doors on one side of the restaurant to accommodate a larger party with a dog. Why not just have this party sit outside? By having them sit half inside/half outside with the open doors, it made the entire restaurant cold and unpleasant.

The Plain Bad:
I ordered the avocado benedict and it was the least flavorful benedict I have had in SF. My boyfriend agreed it was completely bland - "like eating milk." There wasn't even any lemon flavor to the hollandaise sauce. The eggs were poached well but the dish was bordering on cold which was REALLY weird given that our order was the only one at the time since they were initially so empty. I promise I'm not usually a food temperature diva as long as the food tastes good, but this dish was a miss on multiple fronts. 

We also ordered the french toast as dessert and it was dry and overcooked. Spend your brunch budget elsewhere.
author: Anna J.

description:
You won't find romance at Sabrosa...this restaurant is absolutely the loudest I've been in. The chatter of crowds of people bounces off the thin walls and goes straight into your poor eardrums. I had to just do the nod and smile when my husband was speaking because I couldn't hear anything he was saying.

What you will find is awesome and unique food. I really enjoyed the chicken soup with avocado and other unexpected ingredients. Very tasty stuff! 

The best part of my experience was at the bar though. Carla, the bartender did an amazing job. I was so hesitant to try "spicy" cocktails, but as busy as she was, she politely explained the drink menu and listened to my explanation of my taste buds. She prepared me some type of mildly spicy, absolutely delicious cocktail. Kudos to Carla! 

I'll definitely be coming back to try out more interesting food and make sure Carla will prepare the awesome drinks. I just want to know, is there a slow time at Sabrosa, if not, I'll just bring some ear plugs!
author: Irina R.

description: Way too expensive for small portion size and mediocre food.  And, forget a leisurely Sunday brunch.  It is so noisy inside that we ate, and got out as fast as we could.
author: Lxs S.

description:
Ambience - young and poppin!

Food - excellent

Service - excellent

I had the steak tacos, guac and Macho, they were all excellent!
author: Raj K.

description:
I generally like this place, although some things are hit or miss. The hits are the beer menu (again see my other comments about Sol on the menu) props to that. The tacos are pretty solid, specifically the carnitas. 

The misses are the chips and quesadilla...i think they are trying too hard...something is just not right. 

the bar is really cool and they have great drinks. 

It's not quite on par with my favorite taquerias in the city but for what it is trying to be (upscale mexican) it is solid.
author: Derek S.

description:
Pricey, but isn't everything worth going to in the Marina? If you're willing to spend the $$, it's amazing. 

We went there the first week it opened and it was great. Bartender was friendly, service was fast, food was good. Had a huge Poblano Pepper stuffed with pumpkin, quinoa (?) and feta, and El Palomo cocktails. Yum.

Went back about a month later and had drinks called Oaxican Firing Squad. Best cocktails I'd ever had.... until..... our next visit. 

Third visit, we had Margaritas (good) and Pepino Diablos (INCREDIBLE!!!!!!). Seriously - the Pepino Diablo is a MUST. Jalapeno infused Reposado Blanco, muddled cucumber, lime, simple syrup and a salted rim. I am 100% going to try to recreate this at home... To eat, we had chips and a trio of salsa (broken record, I know - but the best salsas I've ever had, and the chips? More like light, flaky, crispy and salty pillows of goodness), a trio of tacos (all amazing - especially the Baracoa ones), and Posole soup that was SO SPICY, but SO PERFECT. Came with a side of different topping to sprinkle on and mix in, which is really a nice touch. The Posole wasn't pretty to look at (looked like black motor oil), but tasted like the perfect blend of spices and soft chunks of hominy.

Done and done. We'll be back.
author: Brianna T.

description:
I went here for a Yelp Elite event and came back with my roommates since they wanted to try it.  I was a bit disappointed.  Though the food was delicious, the portions were really small for the price.  I ordered a Brussels sprout quesadilla.  I was expecting two tortillas, but it was one folded, for around $12.  The only thing my roommates and I enjoyed was the chips and salsa which came with three different salsas.

The drinks were okay too.  My beer cocktail came with ice though, which I wasn't expecting and made it watery in the end.  The only shining star is the service.  Service is really friendly and helpful.  I just wish the food can live up to that.
author: Vira P.

description:
First off, I have been here so many times and I loved it but after this last visit, I really don't see myself coming anymore. I live in the Outer Sunset so I make the trek because the guac is amazing (and it still and forever will be my favorite guac in the city) so this is hard to write.

My boyfriend and I came and long story short - we waited 1 hour to place our order. We tried to get our waitresses attention a lot - people who came before us got their food first. It wasn't crowded - lots of tables were open. Luckily it was so nice out. My boyfriend got his drink and 20 minutes later I still didn't have mine my boyfriend had to remind the waitress. (we were charged for two of my drinks so we had to bring that up to the waitress who fixed it). She was nice but this was just not okay to wait that long and if we didn't say can we pleassssssse order now we would have waited longer. 

My boyfriend wasn't impressed with his meal, and he will eat anything. We were really just bummed when we left as Sabrosa was our FAVORITE spot in SF. It was just overall a really awkward experience and our bill wasn't cheap which makes me upset. The service was not worth what we paid. I don't know what happened here :(
author: Em O.

description:
Food was ok, nothing great, but fine.  Drinks were above average.  Went during a dead Thursday happy hour, but was charged full prices.  Sent the check back not once but twice to get the right bill (which they were nice about but really, twice?). 

Won't go back.  Ever.  Too many better options.
author: Java Z.

description: Good food. Went on day of Santa con (not as santa) and even though it was hectic and people were loud and obnoxious, the staff remained calm and attentive to our table.
author: Merail O.

description: Great mexican joint with many good options. I personally chose the loaded nachos with carnitas. The dish had a healthy portion of cheese and avocado and wasn't too heavy with meat. The balance of each ingredient was perfect, not feeling like any one ingredient overpowered the dish. We also had the three sauces with chips which was nice side dish to get our appetites warmed up.
author: Jackson S.

description: Good tacos and margaritas! I stumbled upon this place with friends. It's close to a few other bars if you're interested in a bar crawl. Spacious. Beautiful neighborhood in the marina. Will return
author: Jasmine N.

description: I was very impressed by the food and drinks. I ordered the nachos, chips and salsa and floutas. The chips are homemade and are amazing. A very trendy scene with a wide range of ages in attendance. Sunday's they have a DJ play the lateat hits along with the classics. My girlfriend and I were served by one of the Managers, Nicole. She was very friendly, energetic and gave us suggestions on what appetizers were the best. The bathrooms are clean and smell good and the prices are totally reasonable for the area. Next time I'm in SF I'm definitely going to make this a regular destination for us! PS - Rumor has it that some players from the Warriors frequent Sabrosa.
author: Parker C.

description:
My review got bumped to three stars instead of two because the food was tasty. But the environment was not my style. 

While the decor is great, kind of rustic modern, the music was terrible. It was loud, and all they played was Top 40 hits with a Spanish flare. And the crowd was younger preppy kids out for brunch on a Sunday.
author: Ana S.

description:
Went here for the first time last night and overall had an okay experience. A group of 5 of us had dinner at 6:15 and the restaurant was essentially empty (there were two other people at the bar) but the restaurant became busy around 7:30 or so. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice, we were seated at a big round booth which was perfect so all five of us could talk. Our server was nice, it took about 15 minutes for her to walk over to our table but once she finally came and took our drink order she was attentive for the rest of the night.

The food was good, not amazing but good. We got the guacamole, sabrosa salad, brussel sprouts + asparagus quesedilla and then each got an order of three tacos. I was worried this would be too much food but the tacos are TINY so it actually ended up being a perfect amount of food ha. You are able to pick and choose which of the 8 or so taco options you want for your order which is great but it was kind of a mess getting them. 4 out of 5 of our orders were wrong -- they fixed it as quickly as they could but I think they have some kinks to work out still. 

I probably will not be rushing back here was there are better places to eat Mexican food in the city. It was also much pricier than I was expecting it to be. They do have wine Wednesday where bottles are half off but that'd probably be the only draw to really get me back.
author: Lizzy U.

description: The music was so loud the waiter could not hear get our order therefore it came out wrong. And when they finally got our order right, the music was so loud the food tasted bad.
author: J L.

description: I made a reservation for 9 people for a special occasion. When my party arrived, the place appeared to have turned into a club, and their intention was to set up a table inside where the music was too loud for conversation. Nobody called me and told me this would be an issue. We then had to scramble to find somewhere else, no easy feat for a party that big. The occasion was ruined.
author: Allison C.

description: Wow! Amazing. Came in on a whim before we went back to LA and I'm so glad we did. Atmosphere was a little loud for my personal taste especially on a Saturday at noon, but besides that, no complaints, great service, food was amazing. Got tacos, carnitas and carne asada, and I probably could've had about 3 more of each they were so good, overall a great experience.
author: Tanner H.

description:
First time trying this restaurant and we loved it. It's obviously Mexican food and who doesn't love that. Sean was our server and he was awesome! Very friendly and always there when we had any questions. What we loved most was that this restaurant serves happy hour EVERYDAY! What's better then that!! 

We tried the quesadilla chicken, chicken tinga tacos, shrimp tacos, tostada ceviche and ceviche aguachiles.. We loved everything! And everything except tostada aguachiles was on happy hour. All together our bill came to 43.00$ but that's including a beer and a shot of tequila. We will definitely be back.
author: Michlle B.

description: I have a simple rule, if they charge me for an ice tea refill I don't ever come back, also they have a guacamole with strawberries that tastes really weird, avoid!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Just so underwhelming and over priced considering the amazing Mexican food available in San Francisco. 

Terrible service. Better off going to TACKO, Tacoliscious, Mamacitas or basically any other Mexican restaurant in the near vicinity... Including Taco Bell across the street.
author: Samantha F.

description:
Went back again last Friday. Serivce was a joke-Would bring 2/4 drink order back to table and forget the other 2 and then bring them. Our orders were always out of sync.

Food was cold and just plain bad. These guys need to get it together. They've been open close to a year.
author: Jon D.

description:
The wife and I stop in for a bite to eat today, first time after many months of walking by. Nice room, but the lack of a host left us standing around wondering what to do next. Finally noticed but the bussed who quickly sat us with menus and watered the table. Took awhile to get a server but that's ok I learned all about why men should do palates from the misses. And also why I will not be attending palates. 

The food was really good we had some spicy chips (totopos), squash pozole, and carne asana tacos all really will seasoned, and bursting with flavor. 

Overall a good meal, even if the waiters looked strained and short staffed.
author: James K.

description: The bouncers at this place wouldn't let my friends (females) use the restroom after we had spent over $100 at this place. Literally like three bartenders for 200 people on a Saturday night. This place sucks...
author: Nicholas S.

description: I come from MX and was transferred to the US a couple of years back. I was amazed in the tastes this place offers... Not your typical TexMex and not even the typical northern MX food we find everywhere. Rather authentic and great flavor. This might look like a bar... Which is, but dare to try for food and then get some awesome drinks afterwards.
author: Beto L.

description: The food here was good, but the service and prices were not. $20 burritos and tacos. The waitress we had did not pay very much attention or ask if everything was alright. At one point she even went to refill my drink, forgot about it, and I never got it back. Overall it was an okay experience.
author: Jeff L.

description:
sexy y deliciosa Sabrosa!

MUST order:
-Guacamole with jalapeños and pomegranates. So refreshing and addictive!
-Flautas the meat is so tender, and the portion is great.
-Carnitas tacos! The carnitas just melt in your mouth.
-Mayan spiced ribeye was juicy and had such an amazing taste. It came with plantain and roasted brussels... they were delicious.

Chef Anthony did such an amazing job. He even came out to check on how I was doing-and remembered my gluten intolerance after my first visit!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
COCKTAIL TIME....

I had two really down to earth and sweet bartenders, Sean and Dj, who stayed very attentive to my needs. They were very knowledgable with the cocktail menu, and even told me that if I didn't care much for my cocktail, they would replace it for me until I was 100% stoked on it. (No really, that's verbatim!)  Hard to find that in bartenders, and I am enthralled! 

-MACHO margarita is delicious! They roasted the peppers right in front of me!!
 -Mezcal Margarita was great also... So refreshing and tasty.
-Pepino Diablo and Oaxacan Firing Squad is a must try too.
-GIN drinkers: I do highly recommend the Sun Flower. It has the perfect "craft cocktail" feeling, and the perfect amount of acidity.

I also tried Dj's KICK ASS MULE. Not on the menu. It's a neat twist on a mule with jalapeño! I highly suggest it.

I am so happy with Sabrosa time and time again. The staff is so fun, and accommodating. Can I give more than 5 stars? Can't wait to go back!!
author: Becca D.

description:
Have been meaning to come here for quite some time, and can honestly say I was really let down. The drinks and decor were alright, but the restaurant was empty! Granted, it was a Wednesday night and my group was there on the earlier side..we kept waiting for it to fill up and it never did. The service was pretty good, but it was the mediocrity of the food and the higher-than-expected bill that left a sour taste in my mouth.

With the abundance of restaurant options in the city, I will not be returning to Sabrosa.
author: Lauren C.

description: Best Mexican spot in the Marina! Bar staff is awesome, dinner was super tasty and they had a DJ come on late night. We ended up staying and had the best Saturday. Great times!! We will def be back!!
author: Kyle L.

description: I am leaving this review especially for today and for the manager (i think he belongs to Brixton)  who was working his shift here just today,thank you for your extra generosity , i hope your team will see your vision and appreciate it because that is the attitude that can drive a business very far!! Cocktails were amazing!! Thank you again!!
author: Nina H.

description:
Met one of the owners; got new staff,  location is awesome guacamole is the best in SF!  Great music great food love love love! Thank you adam and Eric!!!

Update: Saturday nights they have a DJ and it's always amazing sets, great drinks and the food is bomb!
author: Kelly M.

description: The food is actually pretty good here, but the service is terrible because they never have enough staff, whether in the kitchen, at the bar, or on the floor. I've been here many times when the wait has been interminable. Makes it hard to keep going back and I think I'm done with the place.
author: K. L.

description:
good for later lite dinner/snacks & drinks, def scene but nice vibe, good tunes, dark & ambiancy.
 good cocktail list, pricey, service was slowish but otherwise good & nice.
Liked the shrimp tostados $9, & melted queso & chips nom. The chips are homemade, thick-crunchy goodness.
I would go back to check out brunch. Love the lights.
author: Gabi M.

description: Food is great, and the decor is sparkling! Their mixology is also impeccable! Always a great place to stop for an appetizer, a cocktail, or a meal. Nice calm venue for meetings also.
author: Tamas G.

description: Had brunch with my girlfriend  today, service  was attentive  and prompt. She did a great job. On the hand, the other part of our experience  was dreadful. First off, we had the enchiladas,  the rice was barely  cooked. Pretty much raw. Second, the music was so LOUD that we couldn't  have  a  conversation,  we were 2 feet away and couldn't  hear  each  other.  It was like we were at a night club.  it was 2 o'clock  in the  afternoon.  The bartenders were doing  shots of tequila  like it was a bachelor  party  in Cabo. Probably  won't go  back. The only thing that saved this place was the kind, sincere service  of our waitress
author: Justin W.

description:
Food sucks - Lacks flavor. Had to use A TON of hot sauce. 
Drinks suck - Tasteless and too strong. 
Service - Place was not packed-- The waitress helped us after 15 minutes waiting for someone to take our order. 

This is my FIRST bad review-- Should speak volumes. ZERO stars-- Does NOT deserve any stars.
author: Ritika P.

description: I came here for Saturday happy hour from 4-7pm. This place has an upbeat vibe with loud music, pretty girls, and good drinks. I like that they had comfortable outdoor seating. I got the happy hour special: shot, draft beer, and taco for $10. It's a great deal since beers are normally $6 and tacos are 3 for $14. Other things on the happy hour menu are $5 apps and cheap margaritas by the glass/pitcher. The shot was the house tequila, good beer choices lagunitas, Stella, etc. and we got to choose a taco from the dinner menu. Tried the carne asada and fish, both were flavorful with good sauces, tortilla could be better. Only mishap was they brought me the wrong beer, however she gladly brought me the correct one and let me keep the wrong beer. Overall the service and food was great during my visit.
author: Van N.

description:
The food here was pretty underwhelming.  Not bad, not good, just meh. 

I came here a month or so ago on Saturday for brunch and tried the ceviche, kale salad, chicken soup, and chilaquiles.  The only dish worth noting was the chicken soup, which was hearty.  Definitely don't get the kale salad, as it was quite bland.

This place is relatively new, so hopefully they can pick up their game.  Until then, I probably won't be returning.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Came here for Sunday Brunch. 
Good margaritas & yummy chips. Order of guacamole was pretty small, especially for $9. It was good, but not worth the price. FIsh tacos were okay, beans were blah. Tacolicious has much better food, if you can handle the scene... Mamacita, if you can't. I likely won't go back for food.
author: Janell H.

description: Second night here.  Dinner first night was amazing.  Great service and very cute waitress.  Loved our family.of 9 and never kept us waiting.  Tonight on Monday night.  Was slow but Slater the bartender and manager were awrsome.  Best margaritas I have ever had.  All natural and no Goss simple syrup.  Sangria my wife had and loved as well.  Come here if ur local.  We from San Diego staying at close hotel and this place is off the hook. Thank u and see u tomorrow night again for my night cap. By the way.  Slater and the manager are awesome!
author: Tim T.

description: I love Sabrosa because it's in a great location, the food is always good, and the diablo margarita is SO YUMMY. Definitely great for large groups at the last minute, which is why we end up here at least once a month. It's a little overpriced for Mexican food, but what isn't overpriced in the Marina? Overall no complaints - the tacos are my go-to, and their chips are so addicting.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Holy margaritas. We just stopped for guac and margaritas on our walk around the neighborhood, and it was PERFECT. You have to stop here. GO NOW. 

Not even kidding.
author: Katie L.

description:
We were a group of about 10 and had ordered quite a few items off the menu for food and drinks but only a handful of them were good.
The only cocktail I enjoyed was the honey and basil. The others that I tried were the russian mule  and  Pepino Diablo, both were average.
For food I would recommend the shrimp and carnitas tacos, the guacamole and the ceviche (about average). 
The vegetarian and fish tacos were very disappointing.
This would be a good place if you are in a group and want to enjoy a few drinks, not so concerned about the food. The place has a nice ambience and a lively vibe to it. It can get a bit noisy though.
author: Varun A.

description:
Ended up here after the epic failure of Ramen Fest. This place saved the day.

We had a lot of the menu, guacamole, tacos, enchiladas, REAL ceviche, chips and salsa. The margaritas were awesome.

Staff was excellent. 

You're ok sometimes, Marina.
author: Derrick V.

description: I am appalled with the employees behavior and their demeanor towards their customers. We visited the restaurant for late night where everyone was dancing and being obnoxious/rowdy. I am EMBARRASSED with how they treated my friend in the world we live in today. Every person who is above 6 feet tall are able to touch the lights while on the dance floor, my friend was pinpointed for "messing" with the lights that were above our heads and kicked out. I was also touching the lamps but not kicked out of the bar. I 100% believe my friend was discriminated against for his sexual orientation while other people were not kicked out for touching the lamp. I will say again that I am appalled at the behavior shown by the employees from this establishment. I will not be going back due to their discrimination towards a homosexual and their RUDE attitude. 0 stars given for their hate.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I'm part of a pretty big group of friends that frequents Sabrosa for a variety of reasons.  First, they have not only an awesome Happy Hour menu, but the best drinks and bartenders around.  If you're looking for good Mexican/South American cuisine, I HIGHLY recommend this place, too.  My personal favorites are their Tlacoyo app, and they have the best mole, carnitas tacos, and ribeye around (yes, the ribeye at a Mexican restaurant!).  

Our service has always been great, and we've become pretty good friends with some of the bartenders and even the GM purely because they have consistently been so friendly and accommodating. 

Bottom line, whether you're just looking for a good Happy Hour with friends or somewhere to take a date or the family for guaranteed good food, drinks, and service...definitely check out Sabrosa.  Patio sitting on Greenwich and Fillmore couldn't be better either!
author: Alex M.

description: Ordered a Long Island. This is not a Long Island. This is tequila with juice. I had all my friends try it, definitely not a Long Island. Next time you have your waitress rush us out for "last call" at 11 make sure she can make a Long Island.
author: Karissa L.

description: The food is amazing. And the ambience is fun! Bingo on Wednesday has surprisingly good prizes. Rachael is the best server! So on top of it. Can't wait to come back!
author: Erin H.

description:
Amazing.  After my experience, the Manager followed up with me and offered me a second shot.

Last night completely made up for any lag in the service that we experienced when we last got take out.  Our waitress (brunette) was really really nice and one of the best I've had in the Marina in a long time.

The Luna Pinot Noir is amazing.  And so are the steak tacos, per usual.

Thanks for a great night, Sabrosa!
author: Maggie P.

description: Great cocktails and a great spot to sit outside in the Marina!
author: Kelly K.

description: I've been back a number of times since my initial review and I can definitely say the food has gone downhill.  They may only be good at making vegetarian food (I was with a vegetarian the first time) but the meat dishes are seriously lacking in flavor/finesse AND during brunch my friend ordered the chilaquiles that arrived without (get this) SAUCE OR CHICKEN. So he basically got chips with a poached egg. By that time I had already learned to eat before I come here and just drink the yummy cocktails, so that is my recommendation for you-DRINK DONT EAT :)
author: Raina D.

description:
I ordered 2 steak tacos and 1 shrimp. Not bad but not a typical taco. A small, single  tortilla holding together few little chunks of meat and a slice of radish. They did not fill me up, nor the other 4 ladies in our party that ordered the same. The small dollop of guac for $9 was pretty sad but Marina. Guess I should have eaten some more chips.  I'd recommend ordering an entree to split with a friend. The entree portions are bafflingly large, and my friend's dish was pretty tasty. Thank god. Literally saved me and 2 others from starving.

We had to ask the waiter for napkins. And silverware. Glasses for water for the water carafes on our table. We were ordering plenty of cocktails but you gotta keep it balanced through dinner at least! Maybe he was new so I don't consider this worth docking the restaurant overall.

Not sure I'd come back here. Mexi food game STRONG in SF.
author: Aubrey O.

description:
We went here for dinner last night and had the most hilarious/awful experience.

Our reservation was for 8pm and the table was about 20 minutes late, but the cocktails were strong and delicious so we didn't mind. Probably the only redeeming quality of the restaurant. We finally were seated and after ordering our food we proceeded to wait for almost 60 minutes before our food came out. During which time a server tried to bring us other peoples food 3 separate times. Literally we had to tell random servers our order repeatedly. When our food finally arrived it was mediocre at best and seriously over priced. They try to fill you up with the thickest chips on earth to distract from the fact that their quesadillas are actually one tortilla folded in half with small amounts of anything. 

We finally (after two hours) asked for the bill which they promptly brought with several items we never ordered on it. Amazing.
author: Marisa L.

description: The food was good (especially the home-made chips), but they kept all the windows wide open on a sunny but chilly and breezy day so that the restaurant was literally a wind tunnel, with gusts so cold that my hot omelette became a congealed cold omelette before I was half-way through. My guess is that they hoped to draw people off the street by appearing to be super obviously open. But it made for a challenging dining experience.
author: Morris R.

description:
Old City Tavern location spruced up nicely and up scaled into an elegant lounge and Mexican restaurant. Beautiful translucent marbled bar with back lighting, nice substantial furnishings in the booths and tables, both Quattro and communal. Comfortable, casual understated elegance in clean mission colors. 

The food and drinks are good. Prices are not cheap, as Aps will cost you 8 or $9 and entrees will around $20 each, more or less. 

A lot of beautiful, successful 30s something women having GNO here midweek. Just saying! 

20% off lunch with yelp check in. In the old City Tavern location in the Fillmore "Triangle" area 1 block from Lombard.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I look forward to eating here at least once a week! 

I tend to try and eat "healthy" and now I have found a Mexican place that is "Organic and Local" and the food is amazing to boot (not to mention the life changing margaritas and cocktails)... Love it! 

Here are my favorites: 

1) Pepino Diablo
2) Guacamole (made by hand daily)
3) Carnitas plate
4) Bruselas con yema de huevo
5) Fish Tacos (happy hour)

Service is great, and Sabrosa also boasts a pretty cool ambiance and now that the sound insulation is in, the place deserves a strong 5 star rating! 

Definitely a must try.... or repeat and repeat, and...........
author: Chris P.

description:
I gave Sabrosa a second try about a year after a fairly bad first time there, and unfortunately didn't have a great experience the second time around.

The food is just OK - it's nothing special and not worth the prices. I was disappointed in particular with the Brussels sprouts, the Sabrosa salad, and the Bloody Mary's - all fairly flavorless.

They did have good guacamole and soup.

The staff was extremely unattentive and fortunately the manager stepped in to take our order after about a 25 minute wait at our table. 

I'd rather go to Mamacita or Padrecito any day.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Sabrosa is an upscale, trendy take on your typical Mexican meal. Guacamole brightened with strawberries and cucumbers, or pomegranate and sunflower seeds depending on the season, and massively long spears of chips that might just be the best damn fried tortillas this side of the border.

I highly recommend swinging by during happy hour- every day from 4- 7pm where you can get an array of fancy tacos, guac, and salads for discounted prices. They also have great outdoor seating overlooking the throngs of Marina queens and kings prowling Fillmore. If your'e into that sorta thang.

For food, my go-tos are the previously described chips and guacamole, ques-tacos (also known as strips of flavorful steak served a top corn tortillas and broiled with melted cheddar cheese. It's basically a mix between a really good, crispy grilled cheese and a taco. Do it.), and their flautas- meat (I don't care what kind) wrapped in fried tortillas, dipped in the most delicious melted refried bean and cheese sauce. I don't know what it is, but it's going to haunt my dreams for the next two weeks.

Their drinks aren't my favorite (a lil too strong for my liking), but the food is great and so is the ambiance.
author: Rachel L.

description: Came here for Happy hour to watch the Giants. Enjoyed several tacos, all of which were very good!  Carnitas taco was excellent as was their cochinita pibil.  We also got their trio of salsas and all were very unique and yummy. Only disappointment was the ceviche. Sauce was too strong and acidic.  I couldn't taste much else. Margaritas were made to order and excellent. I would def go back!
author: Carla F.

description:
Sabrosa is saved from a 2 star rating because of the truly catering service. Our waiter and the hostess were both so friendly and accommodating - I really disliked the jalapeño margarita so they replaced it for free with the classic margarita! 

However, I really wish I could say the same for the food and drinks. Maybe it's because I'm spoiled by delicious Mexican food and my inexplicable obsession with T-lish, but I have high standards for my tacos and guac and Sabrosa really fell short on the delivery. The carnitas tacos were dry, lacked any semblance of flavor and simply disappointed. The Queso taco, although seemingly unique and filled with a cheddar layer on the surface, fell flat as well. The meat was dry and the tortilla texture was off.

Given the amazing service, I really didn't want to dislike Sabrosa yet and was hoping the margaritas could make up for it. And while they weren't awful, they definitely weren't anything to write home about. My attempt at being a novice mixologist at home far surpassed the quality of these margaritas. 

So yes, the ambiance is great - cool interior design and very open vibe. And yes, the service is spectacular. But unless Sabrosa really steps it up with the food, apps and drinks, it's very hard to justify anything more than 3 stars.
author: Priya S.

description:
I suppose if we were looking for a bar, it would have been perfect.. but let me just share my experience... after our friend finished the SF Nike Womens Half Marathon and we volunteered, of course were pretty hungry, we originally had reservations at Crustaceans, but opted to try this spot since it was close... HUGE MISTAKE.. first off, there were quite a few empty tables in the restaurant, but the hostess informed us that there were for people that had reservations... okay, so we sat at the bar... I initially ordered a shrimp tostada, which they didn't have tostadas.. I think.. never did get clarity on that.. so I went with the fish tacos... it took 45 minutes for our 3 orders to be prepared and a couple sitting on the other side of us got their order before us!! Really?? The customer service sucks... we had to inquire several times about our food being prepared... when it finally got there, we almost got up and walked out.. yes, really! Small portions.. as far as taste.. so-so. I asked for salt, the bartender had to go in the back and came out with this cute lil' container and a spoon.. when my friend asked for hot sauce.. same thing.. lol sometimes its not about "presentation" just give us the condiments! 

Again, if you're looking for a nice bar, its probably great.. the bartender was doing an excellent job of getting the drinks done right!  

Final thought, as we were leaving the hostess totally ignored us... unprofessional! 

ps there were still empty tables when we left (so much for reservations")
author: Miz W.

description:
Definitely an amazing upgrade from the previous: City Tavern.  We were here this past Satuday night.  My friend and her guy got there before us.  My boyfriend and I were running a bit late, so I was happy that they seated them before we showed up.   The location of the table was perfect by a huge corner window... right in front of a big flat screen TV and next to the bar.  I was all geared up in my Warriors: Curry shirt for game 7 at Staples Center.

The service was great, our server was super friendly and attentive.  I've been here recently before for happy hour, which was excellent... so I persuaded my boyfriend to order the carnitas so we can share it.  He loved it, as I did.  We got to taste the steak, and that too was very good. Overall had a great time; just wished the Warriors beat the Clippers that night.  But they gave it their all till the very end, and at least it was nothing like the Spurs-Mavericks game:)
author: Myra M.

description:
The food was not very good, and I don't recommend going here.

I had the Ceviche de Pescado Con Fruta, and I also tried the flank steak tacos.  Mediocre at best.  The Aquachile Rojo Campechano was slightly better then the Ceviche.  The chips and salsa were the best part of the meal.  

What didn't I like exactly?  Well the ceviche tasted really fishy, which the different chunks of citrus attempted to mask, quite unsuccessfully.  And two of my dining companions noted that the steak tacos had a weird aftertaste.  Two thought it was reasonably good.

One of my friends had a quesadilla, which was also better than the other dishes.  I think it had jack and goat cheese inside.  Yum.

I don't like eating in the Marina anyway, especially on the weekends, when you are practically run over by all of the people who come to SF for the weekend, act obnoxious, and can't drive (but maybe this is just me ranting? Although someone almost did hit my car as I was parking, then also didn't stop at the stop sign in front of me.  I was going to call the police but he sped off...)  

Anyway, this was my second dinner of the night, as my first was at Tacko, just up the street, which was about 100X better for price, atmosphere, and flavor of food.
author: Erica L.

description:
Wow... I was expecting this place would be great but boy was I wrong. First off the service - not good - at all - 

Food & drinks - coffee skip it all together - also ordered a diet coke got regular. Took over 40 minutes to get the food. Overpriced for what it is and small portions. Also didn't taste very good either. 

I would not recommend this place to anyone and I will not come back. I would prefer the "chitty" tavern any day over this place.
author: Christy S.

description:
Finally made it to Sabrosa for dinner and I have to say it was excellent!

Each item we tried met or exceeded expectations. The salsa medley was great with three distinctly different blends of heat and flavor! Sabor!!

The Tlacoyo appetizer was like nothing I've ever tried and I wish there was more of it! A "larger" appetizer plate to be sure but still a must have prior to your entrees!!

For dinner the Chuleton Maya (rubbed ribeye) and Carnitas. Wow! This isn't "Mexican food" it's "Mexican flavor inspired food" (much more creative). Mashed plantains instead of mashed potatoes or red rice with the steak is genius! Roasted brussel sprouts; surprise!

One other thing; I've been eating Paleo lately and I'll tell you this menu was easy to stay within "ok foods" and I didn't have to ask for a single substitution!! #bienrico

I'll be back soon!! Def one you should try!
author: Steve B.

description:
So far, the greasiest pibil tacos I've ever had. And so the tortilla chips. You pick one by hand and the oil just drips down onto the basket. 

Wait service is good though !

Prices are competitive for the area. 

I wouldn't come back.
author: Bernardo D.

description:
I had brunch at Sabrosa today and was blown away.  The chorizo/potato gordita is an awesome dish to turn into a split appetizer.  We also had the chorizo scramble (if you can finish the plate solo, I tip my cap to you) and the carnitas torta (the fried egg is a nice touch). 

Great decor and excellent service too.  Put this on your SF list for upscale, authentic Mexican.
author: Mike P.

description: This place is amazing!! I have to say the food is amazing but this service is top notch. I am not one to hype places unless it is well deserved. Joe and Bree Ann are amazing so I would ask for them. If you have not been to this place then make it happen.
author: Drew P.

description:
To be fair, we all wanted to go to Tacolicious down the street, but due to the wait decided to come to this new restaurant Sabrosa instead. We had a party of about 10 people but were able to be seated fairly quickly. 

The tacos, which I think we all ordered, are a bit different than the standard corn tortilla taco you will find at a Tacolicious, but in a good way.  They come out very crispy, but are still soft tacos, we got the chicken tacos. Most importantly they do this special melted cheese step with their tacos to give it a unique crunch and melty combination that is really very good. Will definitely come back to try these again, and would like to explore the drink menu more when I do.
author: Scott H.

description:
Sabrosa was amazing! The perfect place for a girls night out. I CANNOT believe this was once city tavern.

The macho margarita was the drink of choice and was one of the best margaritas I've ever had. Fresh lime juice with a hint of smoky chipotle flavor without being overpowering. Highly recommended.

For the food- we pretty much loved everything. Ceviche, kale salad, the steak entree was awesome and full of flavor.

Check out Sabrosa for date night or your next pre- party dinner spot and I promise you won't be disappointed!
author: Sarah A.

description:
Don't go don't go don't go!  Food portions are SOOO small and the very expensive. I was still hungry after my $13.50 meal.  Service is pretty slow, took 25 min to get our drinks.

I miss City Tavern
author: Ryan B.

description:
Some of the food was surprisingly good but the place was completely disorganized. Waited forever for a drink and when it finally came it was the smallest pour I've ever seen.

The pomegranates in the guacamole were an interesting touch. Ceviche was very tasty.

Not much here for vegetarians. The brussels sprouts quesadilla was about it, but it was very good. When I first saw it on the menu I thought they were just stretching to use brussels sprouts just like every other trendy restaurant in the country right now, but it actually works in this dish.

I happened to be walking by a couple days after eating here and it was closed. Hopefully they're getting a consultant in there because this place has great potential.
author: Mara S.

description: Very boring, tasteless tacos. Ordered through Uber eats. Don't know if that made the portion smaller but it was definitely not enough.
author: Esther R.

description:
If I could give this place a big fat ZERO I would! 

Walked by here with my parents and saw a table outside. Looked like a cool spot with a fun atmosphere for a few drinks on a Sunday afternoon. I went inside to see if there was a hostess or someone to seat us but there wasn't so we just sat at the table outside. There was a check there from a pervious party that was sitting on the table. We sat at the table for 30 minutes until I decided to go find the manager and tell her no one had even acknowledged us! She gave me a pretty sorry apology if you ask me and took our drink orders since that was all we were there to do. The server then came out after her and apologized saying she thought we were the party that was there before, excuse me do we look like the people who were seated here before... doubtful. Anyways, we proceeded to wait another 10 minutes for the beer and two drinks we ordered. Ten minutes to mix a few drinks after they had already ignored us for so long, not okay. We then proceeded to get up and leave because it was so ridiculous and made us so mad!

I have never left a restaurant before nor am I a huge complainer, I understand things happen. However, their lack of service and urgency to fix anything about their poor service was a huge turn off. Will not be coming here again, nor will I be recommending to anyone. Maybe they have good food and drinks maybe they don't, I will never know!
author: Katina K.

description:
My friend and I came by around 8:00pm on a Wednesday and all we wanted was to sit at the bar and drink - and maybe get an appetizer. FAIL.

They had a hostess standing outside the restaurant who informed us that we couldn't go in without a reservation - not even to sit at the bar. (for the record we are well-dressed girls so it's not like she turned us away for that. 

I don't think this city needs a place where you need a reservation to sit at the damn bar. 

Also - I think the $$ is totally inappropriate at a restaurant where the SOUP costs $14 and tacos cost $20...
author: Suzie S.

description:
YUMMY!!
Great location, good service and fun and delishious food.
Atmosphere is fantastic as well.
The guac was good - and I do tend to be a guac snob.  The chips made this even better :)  
Kale and beet salad was delish.
Ceviche = yummy all the way :)
Rice pudding dessert was really a treat as well which was shared and enjoyed by all at the table.
author: Kelly M.

description:
"Sabrosa" means tasty or flavorful. And, that it was! Hurray for a "nice" Mexican joint in the Marina! Boy, were we waiting for you.

Food:
+Guacamole - unique touch with the Pomegranate seeds but there's only like 10 pieces in there so the rest of it is just bland guacamole; PASS
+Carnitas Tacos- SO fresh and tasty; loved the crunch and the salsa; highly recommend
+Quesadilla de bruselas con mole- Brussel Sprouts Quesadillas; the only vegetarian option on the menu but it was amazing, original and flavorful
+Grenada- too lime-y for me and not enough pomegranate for me
+Ginger- non-alcoholic drinks where you can just taste the fresh ground ginger

Service:
We had an extremely friendly male server who checked on us frequently, brought out our dishes quickly and made us want to come back to try their full menu (to come out next week).

Ambience:
Super classy, romantic, intimate but lively. I would bring out of town guests here.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
I am so excited to have some quality Mexican food in the Marina!

We came here on a Monday night and it was pretty busy. Our waitress was amazing and was very knowledgeable about the menu and guided us to our choices. 

We started out with the Rica Y Madura margaritas which are served cold in these cute old school champagne glasses - no ice. 

We ordered the guacamole con totopos for an appetizer which was amazing! The tortilla chips are so thick and flaky - they reminded my boyfriend of the tortilla chips we have at our favorite restaurant in Mexico.We also had the tostada de salpicon de jaiba (dungeness crab tostada) which was very fresh and light. 

For our main dishes my mom and I shared the Carnitas which was plenty for the two of us. My boyfriend got the Chuleton De Res Al Chilmole which comes looking really charred but our server let us know that ahead of time so we weren't surprised and the meat melts in your mouth it is so tender! 

The food, the vibe, decor is A+ we will definitely be back and I can't wait to try out their brunch next time!
author: Jordan C.

description: Love this place, amazing happy hour! Try the white wine Sangria 4-7pm every day!!! You will not be disappointed, great place to watch the game as well ;)
author: William B.

description: I don't ever review restaurants, however, we had a big group go to Sabrosa for a friend's birthday celebration on a Saturday night, and I can't say enough about how well they accommodated us. We had at least 15 people in our party, and when we had to let go of our big communal table due to another party's reservation, the manager (Joe G.) helped us move over the bar. We got awesome service from the bartender Dino, who was very attentive, made delicious margaritas, and got us our food quickly. It's not easy to take care of such a big party, but they did a great job making us feel welcome (and even helping us serve a cake that we brought)! Would definitely go here again to celebrate a Birthday!
author: SanFran F.

description:
A solid three stars, maybe a bit more.  

Service was fantastic.  Everyone here was so nice, helpful, around and available but not in any way over bearing.  I would give 5 stars for service.

Ambiance 4 stars - this is a huge upgrade from the prior restaurant but the temperature was pretty cold inside for dinner,.

Food 3 stars - the presentation is great, everything looked beautiful.  Really enjoyed the guacamole with pomegranate and pumpkin seeds.  The chips were also nice.  The Aguachile Rojo Campechano was also a great appetizer.  We tried the seafood & tomato stew, it was only ok, the rice was very much at the forefront which wasn't really what we would have been hoping for.  Also tried the carnitas, again, great presentation, the vegetables on the side were a little difficult to incorporate into the tacos, the chunkier ones like brussels sprouts and larger beets.  Very good veggies, just a little difficult for the tacos.

This place has a lot of potential.  Hopefully feedback will lead to some minor adjustments and this place can be great.  Would definitely give them another shot.
author: Janelle C.

description: Epically slow service.  We waited 30 minutes for drinks, an hour to order, and an hour for the food to arrive.  Shocking, considering the menu is pretty much street style tacos and stripped down salads.  I'd like to say the service was slow because it was busy, but it wasn't.  I'm pretty shocked.
author: Addison D.

description:
A solid 3.5 (rounded up, because it's better than a 3) stars for Sabrosa. 

This is the kind of place you go with your girlfriends or a big mixed group for a fun, well-priced dinner and drinks. Excellent ambiance for that purpose, as well as a central location in the marina. 

Let's get straight into the food recommendations. We were lucky enough to get some tastings from the kitchen and I recommend the following:
1. Guacamole - yes, it's a boring thing to order, but it was very good. They added pomegranate seeds to it which added a tangy, delightful flavor
2. Ceviche - great seasoning and good seafood. A strong saffron taste (it felt like it, at least), which was excellent

Now on to the minuses (or, as we like to say in strategy consulting, "areas of opportunity")
1. Menu - it needs more diversity. I don't eat pork or beef and found the options to be substantially limited. This is San Francisco, after all, and a menu without ample pescetarian / vegetarian options isn't an SF menu at all 

2. Noise - the sound really carries in this place, and it's definitely not meant for couples on a date (I couldn't hear from across the table and my throat hurt from yelling after we left) 

3. Service. Let me preface this by saying everyone was extraordinarily nice. But I think they have yet to hammer out how service can be effective. Long wait times in b/w ordering drinks and entrees. ...And we had a very strange experience. I ordered the Diablo (I exclusively drink spicy tequila drinks), which the waiter forgot to mention had been made "too spicy" due to over-soaking of jalapenos....instead of a new drink, received a literally watered-down version of my old drink

Overall, it's a fun atmosphere and I would recommend this as a group pregame spot before a night out in the marina. Enjoy!
author: Meghana D.

description:
I had lunch at Sabrosa this afternoon with a friend. She ordered the fish tacos and I had the carnitas tacos and we split an order of the roasted corn.

The food was very good. I'd even say excellent. The portion sizes were perfect. The service was great. 

I have zero complaints. Give it a try.
author: Patsy K.

description: As a bar, this place is fine. Lots of space and your normal drinks menu. The brunch food made me kinda sick though. It seemed as if my Jabba the Hut pooped out the omelet I ordered, and got the order wrong in the process. I was hungover and hungry, so didn't want to send the 'Jabba' omelet back. I guess that's why it was so easy to get a table for a big group. Staff was fine though.
author: Vitaliy D.

description:
It was just ok.... 

I was very disappointed there were no fresh Mexican drinks, as well as my ceviche was very disappointing it had no octopus, that was one of the main reasons why I chose the dish. 

I wouldn't come back to this place again.
author: Veronica V.

description:
We stop by your for lunch and had a variety of things: margaritas, steak tacos, ceviche, soup, and guacamole.  Everything was fresh and prepared with a lot of thought. I like the varied menu and the atmosphere is open and really pleasant. 

From the reviews it seems Sabrosa has a different vibe in the evening which is understandable given the location. I'll definitely be coming back for lunch.
author: Brad C.

description: Horrible. Went in with a large party. Service was ok but the food was awful. Enchiladas were dry and flavorless. Drinks were very pricey! A Margarita pitcher was $40 which only filled three in a half glasses. The only good thing about the restaurant is that the decor and design is beautiful.
author: Jenn J.

description:
Sabrosa is a really fun and another new place I truly feel at home in the city.

  In a part of San Francisco surrounded by sports pubs and dance clubs Sabrosa decides to break the mold with fine dining Mexican food that is only surpassed by the extremely well balanced delicious cocktails and this is what makes me so excited for my next visit.

  After passing by Sabrosa a few times and seeing the beautiful woodwork and amazing job they have done on the bar( stroll by any time after six and the bar will be lit up and gorgeous) I decided I needed to go in and give it a shot and my only regret is that I didn't go in sooner! 

   This place is on point, to start for me i asked the bartender DJ to make me a "crowd favorite" he then asked me what spirit I prefer, I told him I'm at a Mexican food restaurant so let's go with tequila! haha he then asked if I would like it sweet or spicy and I chose spicy, then he asked if I would like to try the pepino diablo which is made from a infused tequila that they do in house, muddled cucumber, lime and simple syrup. the cocktail was remarkable! Dj explained all the ingredients and and wow! Spicy yet refreshing and crisp from the cucumber! I couldn't believe it.

   Next he suggested the tlacoyo and with his home run on the drink I took the advice and got it and wow, that made my night! It was a fluffy yet crispy masa base with beef tips, Avacado, grilled onions, and delicious crema  and another kinda cheese on top but it was so good! 

   All and all this place gets 5 stars because of the great look of the bar, the friendly bartenders, and the great food! 

I would suggest anyone who values good drinks and friendly knowledgeable bartenders to give it a shot!

 I know it's in the marina but I'll tell you what, I gave it a shot and I will defiantly be back again soon.
author: Duke D.

description:
Wanted to catch up with an old friend over some food and drinks without too much noise and this was absolutely perfect for that.

The seafood ceviche was delicious and actually quite larger than most ceviches around, especially for the small price of $13. Our server/bar tender was attentive and friendly and the place never got packed enough to force us to squeeze or shout.

Struck me as a very versatile place, great for many occasions from first dates to large birthday parties.
author: Teiki K.

description: This place is very focused on the bar scene, but their cornmeal shrimp tacos were great! For me, this place is better for dinner on an off-night when there won't be a bunch of marina bros hanging all over the place. Or, if that's your scene, then this would a great place for margaritas and bar bites on a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Fantastic margaritas!  Sean was a very nice server. We had the Carne Asada and Carnitas tacos. Very good, but the carnitas were quite greasy. The chips and salsa trio are a must...be sure to ask for extra chips. Service was slow on a Saturday afternoon. Will probably go back for another margarita before we leave. Nice seating outside with heaters. Inside seemed noisy.
author: Sarah S.

description: We were asked to move from our booth to make way for a DJ, in the middle of our dinner.  We sat for dinner at 7:30PM... so extremely unreasonable to ask us move in the middle of our meal.  They were terribly under staffed, and we had to beg our waiter (who was extremely condescending/couldn't be bothered) to come get us drinks.  Food was good, but the staff and service was horrible.  They need to overhaul their entire team and hire a new manager that has service/food experience, and isn't trying to run the place like a bar.  The kicker:  service was SO bad that I only tipped 10%.  Rather than having a manager walk over and ask me if my service was bad ( which most places do when the tip is low) the waiter put the check BACK ON THE TABLE and circled us for 15 minutes to see if we changed the tip!!  My total was $374 after tip and I saved the receipt b/c I had a feeling these guys were shady... well when I looked at my Amex, they had charged me $20 more-- $394!  Crooks!!!!!
author: Samira P.

description:
We had great service and great food. Portions were worth the price. The seafood stew was great and spicy!  The carnitas quesadilla was unique and very tasty. The home made tortillas are the best!  Loved the salsas too!
I think this new hangout is great so I had to write a review because I only saw negative reviews before I went.
author: Alli K.

description:
This place is awesome! I eat out quite often and I have to say I am thoroughly impressed. Our large party walked into the a newly remodeled City Tavern. The decor was sleek, hip and clean. The hostesses were sweet and seated us right away. The menu was well versed and had many different unique options. Our waiter was very attentive, he brought our drinks and food out quickly. Food was delicious! Yum, get the carnitas!

To top it off the manager stopped in to make sure our party was having a great time. Thanks for making the night Sabrosa!
author: Nicole P.

description:
Sabrosa measures up every step of the way. Great location, beautiful interior, vibrant and attentive service and, most importantly, the food does not disappoint. 
I enjoy the diversity of the drink menu and the uniqueness of the available dishes. Many of the menu offerings I've had for the first time at Sabrosa. Like Tlacoyo: Corn Masa & Chickpea Cake with Beef Tips, Nopales, Guac and Crema. So good! And recommended to me by the bartender. 
The ceviche is delicious as is the Crab Tostada; both things I'm reluctant to try other places. 
If you're in the area and want to watch a game, they have 2 TVs adjacent to the bar. Giants and Warriors always.
author: Lee S.

description: Came in for food and drinks and everything was amazing. The cocktails were great. The pepino diablo was especially tasty. The tacos were really good too. The best part though was the service. Alex is awesome behind the the bar. He makes great cocktails!  Check out Sabrosa - you won't be sorry.
author: Maddie B.

description:
Happy hour rates are everyday - 4 to 7. Pretty darn good deals. Love me a deal and some tacos. Would have been nice if they had some chicken tacos. The fish tacos were awesome! And the calamari tacos were pretty good. Guac was great. 
Not too crowded early on a sat. Would recommend it to a friend for an early dinner.
Changed the channel to the giant's game. Two good sized tvs and a medium size bar.
author: Dylan C.

description:
I'm loving this unique addition to the Marina, that corner was needing an overhaul, big time! The interior is well done, I especially like the under lit natural stone bar that has an amber glow and the hammered brass wall behind the bar. They did an amazing on the decor and the food is is right in line with the vibe. I've eaten there on 3 occasions, twice for dinner and today for brunch. 

Drinks
The mixed drinks are unique and from what I can gather, all fresh ingredients. My fav is the Diablo drink, spicy and delish. For a nice non alcoholic drink, the ginger lemonade is the one. 

Dinner 
The dinner menu is a nice selection of small plates and entrees. My home runs for dinner are: 

Chips and guacamole
Kale salad 
Grilled  half chicken 

But the seared Mayan Ribeye is to die for. It's tender and full of flavor/sabrosa and I will get it every time! I've never had steak prepared like this and there is no way I could make this at home, so it's my go to for dinner. 

Brunch 
I decided to give their brunch a try on a whim today and was very pleased. I sat outside in the sun and could have sat there all day. The  mixed drinks translate well into brunch menu. I was in the mood for breakfast food, so I tried the shrimp omelette. It was delicious, a very nice twist on a traditional omelette. Next time I will try the carnitas  torta, that sounded really good.
author: lyell p.

description:
First, let me give a rave review to  our waiter Sean, he was great,  4+ stars. Our service was what will earn the restaurant a second visit. 

Overall 2.5 stars, but 2 for food. 

Went here with my wife for a casual Tuesday dinner. The ambiance  of the  restaurant  is nice, a bit loud with the few people that were there, it's deafening with larger crowds, however. That said, we love the decor and design. 

Where Sabrosa really misses the mark is with its food. It is simply not good. Almost every item we had was bland and lacked seasoning. Asked for a recommendation from our server , we got the brussel sprouts. BLAND BLAND BLAND. The dish had some shaved fried pepper dust on top which added some heat ,but the onions and sprouts were devoid of any seasoning and dunked in some liquefied,  orange colored animal fat that tasted like unsalted grease. It oozed oil on the palate.   Salt, pepper, lime... something with seasoning , please!

Next we had the ceveche augachile, it was the best thing we had, fresh tasting fish in  citrus  and good chips. Of what we tried, it was the only item I would try again. 

Next we tried a chicken and  also the  al pastor quesadilla. Again, totally unseasoned and in the same thick orange fat. The al pastor was dry and incredibly greasy at the same time. Both lacked seasoning , but the chicken quesadilla was the far better of the two. Both dipping sauces were uninspired. 

I had the luca pinot , fruity and un-aged with no discernible tanin.  I didn't finish it , but the Malkin malbec was excellent. 

I could see that the kitchen was having trouble serving 20 patrons and getting out the food, on a busy night I can see why others are complaining about wait times. 

We will give it a second chance, but the owners need to really taste the food and improve what they are turning out. Sabrosa will have just a few months to turn it around or risk ending up the next incarnation of the  city tavern.
author: Brad S.

description:
The server was nice and the food was delicious! I like the fancy decor too. The portions were normal, healthy sized for most humans, but they weren't "American" sized portions. Guac, chicken quesadilla, calamari tacos, and margaritas were all delectable. Kinda pricey.

I came on a Sunday night and it was pretty calm.
author: Olivia F.

description:
We were looking forward to our night at Sabrosa but unfortunately, it did not go the way we planned. During our disappointing dinner, we started to make a list of things that went wrong during our evening. 

Stood at the door waiting to be seated, saw others waiting as well
Guy who sat us sat two tables from us after sitting and had a beer
No waiter introduced themselves
Had to flag down a random person just to order food and drinks
Drinks took about 15 minutes
Just chips, that we had to ask for, no salsa
"Waiter" came back 20 minutes after we ordered to ask what I ordered again.
Ordered carne asada tacos, was confirmed again when the waiter came back 20 minutes later, yet still received carnitas
$10 tostada was extremely tiny, waiter never asked if that's all I wanted.
Asked for salsa, was given a cup of hot sauce
Noticed all small tables were ignored.
It was not a crowded evening at Sabrosa.

That being said, they comped our meal which was very nice and the margaritas were delicious. MAY come back for a drink at the bar. We hate doing this and haven't before, but it was just ridiculous.
author: Julia B.

description:
Great margaritas. Small food portions, but the food was delicious. Definitely not traditional Mexican food, but very creative. We tried:
- classic margaritas
- guacamole
- steak tacos
- carnitas plate

The decor inside is really beautiful. Worth a visit.
author: Paige D.

description: Delicious food, great vibe, and excellent service. Cool trendy spot. Been to Sabrosa on two occasions. Once for brunch and once for dinner. The margs are on point and I love love love their chilaquiles! Definitley satisfied, I have no complaints. Wish I could visit more. Check this place out if you're a cool cat meow!
author: Jenny J.

description:
I was ready to try a new place that served good food and cocktails... I didn't expect Sabrosa to hand it to me on a silver platter! Everything I tried was DELICIOUS!
 
 Appetizers:
-Trio De Salsas
The chips were great, and the salsa trio full of flavor. The Habanero chile & pumpkin seed was my favorite (highly recommended if you like your salsa HOT)
-Guacamole Con Totopos
The guac with pomegranate and jalapeños were a BRILLIANT combination!! I recommend getting two orders, seeing as everyone in my party wanted to lick the bowl clean.
-Flautas Del Mercado
I have never been a huge flautas fan, but I can't resist these. The rolled tortilla is so flakey and the portion they give you is so big, I am surprised it's an appetizer!
-Ceviche De Pescado Con Fruta
The ceviche had a great blend of flavor for your pallet! Another great use of pomegranate.

Entrees:
-Tacos De Carnitas
They taste so wonderful. However, i do wish it would come in a bigger portion with more warm tortillas. I would pay more to have that option. I loved the pickled veggies on the side!
-Quesadilla De Bruselas Con Mole
I'm a big cheese lover, do the quesadilla wasn't quite what I expected. But I did appreciate all the original flavors. 
-Chuletn De Res Al Chilmole
Can I give this steak 10 stars?!! By far one of my favorite dishes here! I ordered the steak medium and from start to finish it was melt-in-your-mouth amazing! The rub was spiced so perfectly I felt no need for steak sauce. Expected mashed potatoes and got mashed plantain. That was my first time having plantain and I fell in love. I have alway hated Brussels sprouts, but they were so tender and full or flavor. I was actually rather upset I had to share my plate. Next time I will order one for myself.


I've been to Sabrosa twice now, and the food just keeps getting better. I can't wait to try the rest of the dishes!
author: Hannah M.

description:
.My 1st time eating here. Nice atmosphere and decor. Upon looking at menu noticed every thing is ala carte even the specials. So your spending 15-23$ just for your entree plus 5$ for a side of sub par beans and another 5$ for rice. Which i think is ridiculous  i have never been to a mexican restaurant in my life that charges for a basic side such as rice and beans when ordering a dinner plate. That being said for that type of price point i expected the food to be amazing which it was not . I put it at below average at best. My wife  wanted the enchiladas plate with shredded beef but was informed that they Pre make that dish with chicken only meaning it wasn't freshly made to order the other guests with us ordered the salad and soup again looked very basic and sub par . . Like i said if your gonna charge that kind of money for mexican food you better be on point with the your quality and taste of food.  i have no problem paying good money for good food but when i get neither you end up with somebody who will not be returning to this restaurant anytime soon. PS in case you're wondering they do charge for chips and salsa
*Please note that this is rating is for the food only the server was really nice a attentive*
author: Tony g.

description:
Wow! What an amazing step up from Shitty Tavern! I don't know if you've ever visited City Tavern back in the day but it smelled like Paul Walker died there. Too soon?

Sabrosa hits on all major factors for an upscale Mexican restaurant. The layout and design is modern Mexican contemporary with clean lines and geometric intrusions. Their brass light fixtures emanating soft amber lighting creates a cozy space to relax and be visually stimulated by everyone in the room. Amber lighting can even make Owen Wilson look good.

I was really impressed with the Caldo Xochitl. I used to date a girl named Xochitl and not even she tasted this good. It was the perfect soup to dive into when it's cold out which is basically almost every day in San Francisco.
