Now for the piece de resistance, THE MACHO MARGARITA! I won't give away the secret on how this drink is made but get it with Mezcal and you won't be disappointed. I may have drank 16 of these and I could have drank 16 more. Probably the best margarita in town hands down.

Check out Sabrosa ASAP. you won't be disappointed.
author: Jason C.

description:
Came on a Sunday night and it was a perfect way to end the weekend.  The drink I had was light and refreshing and certainly got me boozed up for my meal.  The ceviche was delicious and the staff were super friendly. 

It's usually hard to get my ass out of the Castro, but Sabrosa was a great time.  I would totally go back next time I'm craving Mexican...food!
author: James M.

description: The food is decent but over priced. The service is terrible! Our server had to be asked to give us the check. Once I put my card on it I realized 10 minutes later she was standing in the corner rolling silverware (the place was empty). I had to go ask her to run my credit card. She barely talked the entire time and gave me a dirty look.  I won't be returning.
author: Megan C.

description: Little noisy, little crowded, but their carnitas worth the hustle.  Came here on a Saturday night, we got our table right away and the service was fast too. After 11pm, the profile changes and it function more as a bar/club.
author: Stephan T.

description: Bartender took his own tip last night. Really disturbed by this and didnt feel like making a scene last night because I couldnt believe it. i bought two beers last night, paid with a $20 bill and was slow in taking the change because I was talking to my friend that was sitting with me at the bar. The bartender must have thought we were drunk and quickly took the $5 and said thanks. I had no idea what he was doing and then realized it later. It was late and there were many drunk people in the bar. That is stealing and lame. 20somethings watch out. I am sure the bartenders have to deal with alot of craziness. I was planning to leave a decent tip too.
author: K J.

description: Loved the dishes!Great variety of foods. Like the additions to create a better dishes. Gets a bit loud inside but the outside heaters are awesome.
author: Alma A.

description:
I give it 2 stars because I left full and I didn't get sick. Food here is mediocre, almost totally lacking in flavor. 

The guacamole, and I consider this table stakes for a mexican joint, was really just smashed avocado with some salt added.  To me guacamole shouldn't be a challenge, considering it has about 5 ingredients. 

My wife had the shrimp tacos, which were spicy but that's all she could say about them. The enchiladas were basically flavorless. It was partially my mistake for ordering an entree, I learned long ago that there's no such thing as a mexican entree. 

The margaritas were average but uninspired. 

Ambiance is sort of nice if not for the fact that the place was nearly empty at 7/8pm on a wed. 

The service however was excellent. Our waiter was attentive but didn't hover and the busboys were quick to get anything else we needed. 

Being from back east, this place would be gone with stats like this, if not for tourists to support it with one time meals. But I'm new to SF and cow hollow, will have to see if the same holds true. 

-E coast eater
author: D H.

description:
Ideally, I would give Sabrosa 4.5 stars.  The food, service and drinks are each excellent.  Given that Sabrosa opened just a few weeks ago, I am impressed with how smoothly everything unfolded.

Given the size of the dishes and how the restaurant serves them, I recommend sharing several dishes at this restaurant among 3 people.   

Food to definitely order: The Tlacoyo Con Punta De Res A La Pasilla (delicious), Questacos De Arrachera (delectable and the highlight of our meal) and the Guacamole (very good for a restaurant and the pomegranate seeds worked surprising well in the dish).

Drinks to order: The Macho with Mezcal and then get another one.  

My single issue is the noise level.  They play the background music a bit too loudly which causes everyone to speak louder making the restaurant much noisier than I expected for a restaurant this size.
author: Jason C.

description: Good food. I had Taco's. Very nice atmosphere. Had a Saturday lunch. Yes I would recommend it to my friends
author: Dr. Robert K.

description:
Hard to believe how mediocre this was. Most expensive tacos on the planet!
Oh, and if you want some salsa it is another $5. Go figure as to why no one was there!
2 tables on a Wednesday night.
author: Russell N.

description: Two stars because they actually served food. That does not mean that the food was actually eatable. Let's start at the beginning. We got here and the hostess seemed already fairly overwhelmed with the situation of seating us. Seated, 10 min later someone feels responsible to ask us for our order. The highly unmotivated waitress had a hard time listening neither could she give us recommendation. We ordered the steak taco which contained fatty burger meat. A different taco experience as I'd have expected. The guacamole was okay, nothing breath taking and nothing we would order again. While the waitress never refilled our water nor asked us for a second round of drinks since she was busy counting her tip in the corner. The drinks were the best thing we got during this spectacular visit.
author: Katharina H.

description:
Great Happy Hour.  
Fun happy hour.  I'm not sure if it's that great of a deal but it's a fun atmosphere.  The vegetarian pozole is awesome and I loved the chicken quesadilla.  Tacos are Ok as I tried the fish, beef and chicken.  I would say this place is more of a Nuevo Mexican restaurant so I didn't it to be authentic.  I would go for brunch or happy hour on a warm day and sit outside.   I would still go all the time since it is very kid friendly and it has outdoor seating.
author: VIOLA L.

description: Sabrosa is my absolute favorite go to when communing with friends in the Marina. I am in love with the decor and the vibe. The cocktails are consistently excellent, the Tommy is my drink of choice. I'm a big fan of the guacamole, ceviche and cold salads and I feel that the price points are in line with other similar restaurants in town. The food is fresh and artfully prepared. It is a real authentic expression of healthy, tasty Mexican food with a California twist. I can't wait to go back soon.
author: Leila B.

description: Strawberry sangria was good but ugh the beef tacos? Blech. Huge bite of gristle in addition to a dish of over cooked hard cheddar over mediocre meat. Out if the 3 I could barely eat two. Service was ok.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I've been here twice now, both great.

First for brunch, had the red chilaquiles with poached egg and my friend had a green egg dish with shrimp, both WOW! After a few brunch margaritas we left very happy  with everything and i decided to make myself a resi for last night.

For dinner last night, This time with a bigger appetite. We shared, ceviche de aguachile, tlacoyo, seafood stew & yes the ribeye. Again all the food was on point, delish in every way.

The service both times was great, attentive and nice. Our cocktails and wine hit the spot and the ambience is good considering its in the Marina.

Sabrosa i will be back again
author: Wa D.

description:
We tried Sabrosa out on a rare sunny SF evening mid-week when I stumbled upon their outdoor seating. We were drawn in by the lure of a 3-7pm happy hour, but took my chances with the dinner menu so that we could enjoy the patio seating. I wanted to love this place because the decor was fresh and such an improvement from the dark City Tavern venue. Unfortunately, the only reason I give this place two stars is 1 for the EXCELLENT service (very attentive) and 2 for the decor and open architecture. If you are looking for a good meal, there are plenty of better options in the area.

On the search for a yummy salad my sister and I ordered the chicken cesar and the beet salad and added an order of the chips and guac since that is a sure sign of a good Mexican restaurant! The chips and guac came out first and were fine--homemade chips and light salt (although I though $9 was very pricey). However, when our salads arrived we were both shocked by how salty they were. It sounds crazy, but I swear they SALTED the lettuce before service. At first I thought it was just the cojita cheese on the cesar, but the beet salad was dangerously salty too! Needless to say, we picked at our greens and left starved--and extremely over salted! 

I realize I've reviewed a Mexican restaurant only on the basis of their salads and guac, but we left so unsatisfied and honestly in a salt shock, that I'd never go back for the food. Maybe, just maybe I'll give it another shot to try the margaritas.
author: J A.

description: Tried this for the second time last Saturday and brought our sons with us.  Everyone loved it!  The food is artfully presented and well prepared.  They put an interesting twist on all their food items.  The carne asada tacos were plenty for me as a meal (3 small tacos with lots of tasty beef and avocados and 2 corn tortillas each so they didn't fall apart).  Carnitas also very flavorful and large chunks of perfectly cooked pork.  The enchiladas are served in their own little cast iron pan and topped with some sort of cabbage slaw, also excellent.  Happy hour at the bar is a great deal with good drink and food specials.  We stay at local hotels in that neighborhood when we visit and will definitely return.
author: Laylee D.

description:
I will start by saying that the customer service exemplified by the manager was outstanding, however the food was absolutely horrible.  The chips were okay, but the  guacamole had no flavor or seasoning. I liked the salsa, however the portion size was about one tablespoon.  The crabmeat tostado tasted like the chips with overpowered citrus juice.  To be honest I could not taste the crabmeat.  We had the ceviche as well and it looked like a bowl of soup and tasted like hot sauce.  And now for the finale...the steak tacos...it looked like the crap that falls to the bottom of your oven that you will need a snow scrapper and a bottle of cleaner to remove it.  I was in shock that the kitchen allowed the plate to arrive at our table in that condition.  I won't even try to tell you how it tasted because there is really no words to describe it.  

Overall, this is a great location for a cocktail before you head out to dinner.  Great vibe and atmosphere, just save your appetite for somewhere else!
author: Kelly A.

description: Just walking by with my friend after a long walk and went in to get a bite for brunch. We wanted to also watch the 49er game, so we sat at the bar... and it ended up being a GREAT morning/afternoon. The food was delicious, the service was incredible, and the drinks were yummy. I will absolutely be back here again. Bravo Sabrosa =)
author: Melissa A.

description:
We came here and had a very pleasant experience. The service from the beginning was great. 

Ordered a soup with chicken and avocado, also ordered a ceviche with fruits, and two margaritas. The soup was very tasty, very balanced. It came with delicious fresh tortillas. The ceviche had a very unique and interesting flavor, very different than any of the ceviches I have tried both here and in South America. The fruits have it an interesting contrast of textures. I liked that. The margaritas were generous and strong. 

At first I thought the ceviche was a bit short on fish, and the waitress told me she would remove it from the bill, and kindly asked me if I wanted anything else. I said I didn't, not because I didn't  want (the food was great) but because I was already full. 

She eventually removed it from the bill and even though I insisted them to put it because I really enjoyed the ceviche and wanted to pay for it, the manager came very nicely apologized for what they considered a mistake and told me he wouldn't charge me. 

This is professional, this is caring. This is great service and a group of sincere and honest people. 

Will definitely be back for both the great food and the great service.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I've become a Sabrosa addict. I actually wake up in the morning craving their Chuleton ( juiciest, most flavorful ribeye I've ever sunk my teeth into). 

The aguachile ceviche makes me feel like I'm on vacation. 

And finally a place that serves perfect brothy chicken soup, packed with bright veggies, avo, and topped with a sprinkle of house made cotija cheese- hot, healthy, and satisfying. 

Drinks are dangerously delicious- the pepino diablo would make angels sing. 

Also, one of the best under the radar (though I fear not for long) brunches around.
The omelette with mashed shrimp is an incredible. My husband had to beat my fork away from his plate when he ordered this. 

The sauteed brussels with leeks and a perfectly poached egg yolk broken over the top make me want to hug the chef. 

Hungover?  The gordita will put some pep back in your step. 

And while the interior is gorgeous, with mid 60s temps in the middle of winter, I'll be taking advantage of their outdoor seating.
author: Ella M.

description: I love Sabrosa for the food and their awesome spicy margs, and I like the atmosphere, but unfortunately every time I've been, service is incredibly slow. Doesn't stop me from going there, but definitely something to keep in mind. Not a quick meal.
author: Courtney F.

description:
Excellent Margaritas.  I asked for the agave on the side so that I could make it "skinny."

The Sabrosa salad is delicious.  Ask for it with shrimp to make it a meal.  The shrimp are very fresh and sweet.  My husband had the carnitas and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Nice atmosphere, though it can get loud.  It seems to be a popular spot for large parties.
author: Patricia M.

description:
I don't make it out to the Marina that often so when my friend had his birthday dinner at the new neighborhood mexican spot I wasn't expecting a whole lot.

I rarely give 5 stars but when I sipped on my Sun Flower cocktail I was just like, whoa this is so crisp and refreshing!! The bartender Matt was super friendly and knowledgeable and chatted about how they came up with their specialties. Sounds like a lot of fun creating signature cocktails at a place like Sabrosa!! 

I indulged my love of mexican meat and ordered their Carnitas Tacos. I have to say that the meat did not disappoint. Perfectly seasoned, it was one of those melt in your mouth moments :) 

We all shared, or should I say fought over the Guacamole and it was DELISH!! They garnished it with pomegranate which added a sweet bite flavor. I had never had that before but I am sure I will again. 

The thing that really struck me was the total makeover since the City Tavern days. Not at all dingy dried up bar it used to be, but instead spacious, airy, and inviting. Not to mention the soft lighting that made everyone look like they just walked off a mexican cruise.

I will be coming back here again for sure!! Seems like a nice date spot ;)
author: Alice R.

description: Disappointed by the food.  For all the hype of this hip local eatery, it is more of a cool place to meet for drinks and grab a bite of bar food.  The pictures are all what they look like -- clean, stylish and inviting.  But the food for the dinner menu was not impressive.  We were drawn to the place for the weekend brunch reviews, but tried it on a weeknight.  Our bad?  ....so to be fair here, if you had a good brunch experience here - stick to the weekends.
author: John K.

description: I went here over the weekend and had a horrible experience. I ordered a drink and it did not taste good - the soda water was out and it was the wrong liquor. The bartender tried my drink and agreed that it was not up to par but when I requested a new drink he told me "suck it up and drink it". I was in shock I have never received such horrible service and had such a rude bartender before. Paying customers should not be treated this way. As someone who worked in the service industry before I was highly disappointed with the customer service here.
author: Nicole R.

description: DJ is an awesome bartender because his drinks are amazing and his beard is pretty good too!
author: Taylor L.

description: This place is very medicore. The food seems not too badly priced until you see the portions. We had a chicken caesar and tacos, each about $13 and the tacos were MINIATURE! The salad was the size of a starter salad. Food tastes fine but not great. Really disappointing.
author: Carly K.

description:
Overpriced less than average food. Service is extremely slow due to understaffing. Small salad with chicken for $16 !!!!!the chicken in my salad was blackened. Don't know from what.

Quality came down a lot from 1st time we were there!
Loud music inside. Chips are stale! Nothing good to say about this place.
author: Antonella O.

description:
(We were here mid December)  Even for a 'bar scene' it was particularly loud... you MUST do something about the noise level.  Bar staff and table service staff were very friendly but the timing of everything was, frankly, ridiculous!  Food came out in bits and pieces .... 1 app with someone else's entree... while still waiting for a drink from the bar... 3 had been served waiting for the 4th beverage... Since it took so long for the drinks we ordered the next round when the server finally arrived with that last drink.  Eventually all items arrived. (1 or 2 at a time)  The food itself was rather tasty,  but the rest of the experience took away from that. We were yelling at each other to be heard. (Please note,,  tho I am in my 40's I was with three 24 year olds who love the night time bar scene and they too felt that the noise level was out of control.)

Really like what they did with the place... bar set up.. nice. We sat at the bar for a drink first... then moved to a table.  We specifically asked not to be at the first table by the door... and you guessed it.. thats where the hostess wanted to sit us.  I asked for another and at first the hostess said this is all we  have ... I asked about the 3 assorted available tables up by the window and she explained that they were held for reservations.  I reminded her that we had reservations.  " OH. " '"Hold on" she went and spoke with the other host, returned (literally turned around since the table is butted up to host area) "Well I can give you that other table but you only have an hour." Seriously, you were going to let the table sit  open for an hour!!!!  Me thinks there needs to be  a little retraining up front!!!!! (By the way, an hour later there were at least 4 other open tables... and no, we weren't done... because of the the timing issues noted already)

YES the ceviche is WONDERFUL!!! I would like a double portion please!
author: Kallie K.

description: I LOVED this place! The calamari tacos are off the chain! I would eat a million more every day. The guac was delish but I wish they'd give more than one chip per person?
author: Alexandra W.

description: Mediocre Mexican food in a City with some of the best. Good street side sitting and a fun bar. Fun for a group dinner.
author: Ben C.

description:
Second visit here and am just underwhelmed. It has all the makings of a great spot but something is missing for me. 

Service was pleasant. Prices are about as you would expect for the area but a tad much for what you get. 

We ordered guac right when we sat down but it took almost 15 min to arrive. Guac should be pretty rapid. It was mid day and not remotely crowded. 

Kale/beet salad was really good. 

Ceviche was lacking flavor
author: K C.

description: I heard about this place from some friends and decided to check it out on super bowl weekend. Of course being super bowl every where was packed.The manager Joe was amazing! Even though they were busy & packed he found us a table and sat us down. He continued to stop by and check on how everything was going. My cousin and I were glad we stopped by here! The food was great and the service was amazing!
author: Mary Z.

description: Bar is pretty good.  Food is mediocre at best.  Go have some crunchy tacos across the street at Tacko then drink here.
author: Neal M.

description: really cool ambiance and really good food AND wine! I got the quesadilla and added avocado. Iiwill definitely be back!
author: Megan F.

description: Took 40 min to flag down a waiter to take our food order. Then another hour for our food to come. Some orders never received the tortillas they were supposed to get. Rice was dry, food over priced for what it is. Atmosphere, music, etc is good though.
author: Rachael R.

description: The restaurant/bar is in a very fun part of the city. However, I would probably only come back for the drinks. The guacamole, rice, and beans were okay. The enchiladas were good. Nothing special in the food department, I was somewhat disappointed. The server was great and he apologized for the wait for the food by giving us two extra drinks (it took one and a half hours to get our food). The pitcher of sangria was the best part about this place. I would come here on taco Tuesday's for sure or just as a place for drinks.
author: Max O.

description: After waiting almost a year for this place to open, I expected a lot better from this team and this space. The decor is awesome and the place has great potential - but a few things fall short. The service was not great and our order had several mistakes. Our entrees came out at all different times, and one was cold, one had sauce all over it when it was asked to be on the side, and one was totally burnt. The house margarita was a disappointment. The scene was very old and mostly male. Possibly due to the proximity to Balboa? The one thing I did enjoy was the caesar salad with chicken, delicious. I would possibly do a walkby in a few months and see if the scene looks any better and give it another try. Possibly.
author: Gina C.

description: My fajita was delicious! I got half chicken, half beef- both were great but the seasoning on the chicken the best part. The margaritas were also great. Unfortunately, my husband's tacos were just so-so. I'd go back for the fajitas and atmosphere, but skip the tacos.
author: K W.

description: Delightful Mexican eating place where friendly server was only to pleased to help this celiac from Australia! Delicious tacos!
author: Wendy R.

description: I live in the neighbourhood and was anticipating its opening.  My husband and I went for lunch a couple of weeks ago.  Service was meh...food took forever...as in well over 40 minutes after appetizers.  And I'm not speaking of complicated food...2 salads.  Okay...benefit of the doubt.  We went back today, and we were seated right away.  The "your server will be right with you" was the oxymoron phrase of the day.  Our server was able to go to every table around us but ours.  We were wholly and sufficiently ignored.  A simple "i'll be right with you", and I would not have walked.  And walked we did.  The kicker??  When we told the manager and the hostess, NO APOLOGIES.  Too bad, because the food is actually good....IF and it's a HUGE IF, you can withstand the cold shoulder treatment....and warm salads.
author: Sonia C.

description: I'm an old timer, but I actually liked this place with its good vibe. All young people having a great time with a very courteous and helpful staff. Great service and the food was above par. If you are in Cow Hollow it is definitely a place you want to try.  AND their chips are actually made with healthy ingredients. Go for it and have fun. Great Spanish tapas and entrees.
author: Lorin S.

description:
Check your credit card statement when you receive it. Sabrosa charged us erroneously and would not return phone calls to amend the charge. We protested the charge and scanned our original receipt to send to our credit card company which supported our side & overruled Sabrosa. 
The service and length of wait for food at dinner is ridiculously long--beyond 90 minutes for basic food. The server was in the dark and we were sick of her apologizing for the delay.
author: Janet P.

description: Friendly service, good guac & chips, fun place to go to share plates tapas style with friends.  We had a U-shaped booth that faced the bar, and unfortunately had a full on view of a couple making out so hard they needed a room.  The chick literally started licking his face and he had to take his glasses off to clean off the saliva...didn't know it was gonna be dinner with a show :p
author: Pam S.

description: Always solid food and great drinks. A higher-end way to satisfy a Mexican food craving, or just go for the tequila cocktails.
author: Teri F.

description:
Was treated to brunch on Mothers Day (around 3:30 pm). Better late then never.
Started with the chips and dips.  They were most excellent, not greasy, and 
just the right amount of crunch. My favorite sauce was the red one,  could have passed on the brown one, (not sure of name), but to each her own.
My kale salad was tangy and bitter, like kale is. However the slices of Mandarin oranges,  cheese bits and other garnishes made it very palatable.
My daughter had the French toast. I shared it with her. I can honestly say that was the most amazing French toast I ever had in my life, (and I'm no spring chicken lol.) It was decedent,  it screamed delicious, and not very healthy for you, all at once. But for a once in a while treat, it was so definitely worth it. You must try it, even if not a big French toast fan, like myself.  Imagine marbled chocolate, cinnamon and other sweetness, yummy.
Service was on spot, right there when you needed them to be. Of course I am taking into account we were only one of a few tables when we got there. It started picking up with dinner crowd when we were on our way out.
author: Karen M.

description: Some of the worst food ever. Meatballs were like something from Costco. Hard and very old tasting. Made me and companion sick. Service was very good. Atmosphere is nice, but music was too loud. Won't return, too many other great places in that area.
author: Mary C.

description: Food is absolutely horrible. The Chips and salsa are garbage. They do have great margaritas but the fact that their chip/guac/salsa game is very sub-par is disappointing. Would consider going back for a margarita... would be a regular if they could figure out chips/guac/salsa situation
author: Stephen L.

description: Very tasty brunch. Order anything!  Also, the bar is fully stocked for a fun time!
author: Andy S.

description: Food was over priced,service took forever just to get an iced tea and coffee and when we got our food it was mediocre. As the gf of a chef in this city I was disappointed especially when she offered constructive criticism and then one of the managers called her a b@tch as we walked off I do not recommend this restraunt.
author: Kim N.

description: Just watch out for when they bait n switch happy hour.  Menu says it..,server too...but then they call it off. Food is good for faux Mexican food. Tastier than tasteless Taco Bar in Pacific Heights. But overall, not cool in the way they misrepresent happy hour.   I guess this shadiness only happens in the Marina. Not cool.
author: Paul C.

description: Bad food. Enough said. Waitress was nice and took one of the three things we ordered off our bill, but don't spend your time coming here. Too many other great options.
author: Andre K.

description: Wonderful new spot across from the Balboa. Great interior, design esthetic is warm and understated. The menu is fabulous and the three dishes we shared were GREAT! Cocktails (Pisco Punch) were artisanal and bartender Matthew has good "table-side" manners! We'll be back!
author: Natasha M.

description: The bar itself portrays a very interesting and unique atmosphere. However, this is extremely misleading. While visiting this establishment I quickly learned otherwise. The food was disappointing, the fish and shrimp tasted as if it were frozen for years. They lack variety and I seem to be able to find better tortillas at the supermarket. Mexican gone wrong.
author: Jordan O.

description: I have to say I am a fan of this place! I have only come for the brunch, as its my thing in life, but every time I do come here I have to get the Macho. love the spicy-sweet take on the margarita.  the last time I came I made a reservation for a group of 10 and when we showed up they were more than prepared for our large group.  The guac is tasty as are the other brunch entrée's. I especially have enjoyed the chorizo scramble, torta de carnita's, and the enchiladas. I hope to come back for dinner or their happy hour soon.  As a side note: they also have a couple of TV's so its actually a dope place to catch some sports on a Sunday
author: Shayla D.

description: Service is decent but the food is brutal! Cheese on tacos is grilled hard, small prices of meat, for got tortillas on some tacos, lacking flavor. No way this place should be around much longer.
author: Calvin G.

description: Staff was super friendly and fast. Ambience was great. Food was EXCELLENT. I always go for the safe bet - Chicken. But since I didn't see chicken tacos on the menu, I went with Calamari tacos and OMG.... OMG. They were so good. It's been a week and I'm still thinking about them. I hate driving to SF for anything but if I was invited to dinner here again - I would most definitely be there.
author: Rupa L.

description: Well I typically wouldn't write a bad review about a place who I know half of the owners/bartenders, but last weekend we were treated extremely poor by Hugo. We were outside and as soon as the restaurant closed, little Hugo comes over to our table and aggressively starts snatching (yes snatching) our drinks out of our hands and saying 'you're done with that, you're done with that)  I understand that bars close and you need to have people's drinks finished, but there are classy and professional ways of handling these types of situations. For example (Hugo please take notes) 'Hey guys, we're closing and we're going to need you to finish your drinks, do you mind if I grab them?' This on top of the horrible food makes for a bad choice of restaurants to visit. The only reason this place gets even one star is because I feel bad for the people I know who work there. So many more options in the area who a) have great food and b) treat their paying customers with respect
author: Leslie M.

description: Gone back to this plan and now I'm a fan. We had a great brunch experience and food was delish!!!
author: Mariana A.

description: As a marina resident I was very anxious to see what was being constructed where city tavern once was. I went to sabrosa's grand opening earlier this week and I couldn't have been more impressed. Between the ambiance, the beautiful upholstery and the chic overall feel, I felt like I was in Manhattan. The drinks were to die for- not too overdone with garnishes, and the food was truly gourmet Mexican. I plan on frequenting this new spot until I'm a regular once again :)
author: larissa w.

description: Second time eating here and food was yummy, as it was the first time. Pork chile verde was great, although I have never ordered this before, anywhere. I like that the rice & beans are served in the side. Daughter had the chicken enchilada -also yum. Happy hour drinks $7 marg & sangria. Cute waiter nicely attentive! The only drawback was noisy acoustics! Loved the free trio salsas offered through Yelp!
author: S K.

description: I came in on a Sunday with 2 friends for brunch. Sabrosa has a very nice ambiance upon entry, with big doors, and windows for a refreshing air flow. The service was non existent. We were greeted and asked for our order and that was the one time we were checked on. No check in for more coffee or our meal. The food had a good mix of ingredients and flavor, but nothing extraordinary for $13 chiliquiles. I would come back if I were in the area and craved flautas and a margarita at the bar.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Amazing new restaurant in the Marina that has a super fun and trendy vibe, amazing food and drinks, and impeccable service.

I came here with a group of girlfriends for a birthday dinner and have to say, we picked the perfect spot. It is classy and fun inside and is a great spot to enjoy a night out !

To start, the drinks are so yummy and all very creative. My favorites were the Dos Besos, the Night Creature and the Pepino Diablo. Really, you can't go wrong with any of the cocktails here. 

For food, The guacamole is to die for and it's A MUST! Also the salsa trio is super yummy as well and perfect to share with others as appetizers. 

For entrees, the Chuletn De Res Al Chilmole (ribeye) is beyond amazing. The spices on it are so good and it was cooked to perfection. Also had the chicken quesadilla and the steak quesotacos, both were excellent as well. 

The service was amazing as well and the wait staff was very attentive. 

I can't wait to go back and try out their brunch as well. 

This is a perfect new spot and I highly recommend checking it out !
author: Laura H.

description:
So, Sabora is absolutely amazing.

I have eaten there for bunch and and dinner multiple times and have yet to be disappointed.  I personally love soup more than anything and lucky for me the Caldo Xochitl, which is literally the best soup I have ever had, is on the brunch and dinner menu!  I would not go in without ordering a bowl, highly recommend.

I would also recommend the Chuleton De Res Al Chilmole. I'm pretty sure its the same cut of meat that they use at Brixton for their rib eye but the Chili Dry rub that they use at Sabrosa is amazing.  The thing literally cuts like butter and melts in your mouth! You wont find a better stake for under $30 anywhere in the city, I guarantee it!

If you want something smaller the the Questaco is delicious and not to filling.  If you you that and and the chips and quac it would be a perfect little meal.  

As far as the service, its been great every time.  I have eaten at the bar alone and at a table with a big group and every time the food and drinks came out fast.  The bar tenders and waiters were super friendly and checked on us just enough to let us enjoy our meals and company but not let us go unattended. 

Overall, Sabrosa gets two thumbs up from me.  To be honest, you will probably see me in there some time this weekend.  If not eating dinner than just grabbing a margarita :)
author: Kyle H.

description:
Let's just say, I'm already planning another trip back to Sabrosa.
The decor is very welcoming- the lighting makes you want to come for dinner, and stay for drinks- very sexy! I am in awe with what they did with the old City Tavern.
Start with the jalapeno & cucumber margarita.  Guacamole is a must- they add pomegranate seeds and thin slices of jalapeno, served with organic, homemade  thinly sliced corn tortilla chips. The ceviche was perfectly tangy and extra fresh.  Not sure what they're called, but get the tacos made with grilled cheese, steak and a dollop of guacamole- excellent.  The chicken salad had the best quality chicken I have ever experienced in a restaurant chicken salad- soft, perfectly seasoned.  
Servers were "on it", timely, professional and sweet. Bartenders very attentive and were making a margarita that they lit on fire- wow!
author: Nicole C.

description: Great house margarita. The seafood ceviche was like nothing I've ever tried before. Very unique and flavorful dishes - a must try if you're looking a new upscale Mexican spot.
author: Roya P.

description: We decided to check out Sabrosa for a quick drink and bite to eat. It was a nice sunny day (if you can believe it) in the City. First off, the outside curb furniture set the tone: nice tables, comfortable chairs, and nice presentation of dinnerware. We ordered a margarita and sangria for starters. WOW! The drinks were strong, but very tasty! :-). For appetizers (small plates), we ordered the calamari tacos, chicken flautas and pork tacos. I was not impressed by the chicken flautas and my date didn't finish hers. But, the pork tacos were very tasty, the meat was tender to the bite, and the tortilla was cooked and prepared to perfection. And the clear winner was the calamari tacos! they were so delicious we ordered another. I definitely recommend Sabrosa for a quick stop with friends for some small plates and great drinks. Next time, we'll try the entrees. :-)
author: Marcus M.

description: I came here with a group of girls for my birthday dinner. Worst mexican every disgusting. Chips tasted like Fritos. No joke. Worst chips at any mex restaurant ever
author: Chi Girl L.

description: Been here about 10 times now over the past year and I have seen this place getting consistently better.  It has become a reliable place to go for good food, solid drinks and a fun atmosphere.  I definitely recommend it for those looking for a casual spot to go out with friends as well as a nice place for a date. Service is consistent and friendly.  If you're a fan, go for the mezcal marg, if not, the Tommy's marg does just fine.
author: Rick J.

description: Found Sabrosa more by chance than anything else. Nothing like a good parking place in the Marina. Started with guacamole and housemade tortilla chips (with a surprisingly tasty garnish of strawberry, onion and cucumber). We enjoyed that through lunch with a chip re-load. Yum! Our other appetizer was flautas with a chicken filling served with beans and crema. That was not bad but desperately needed a compliment of salsa or citrus to cut the bean purée. We had tacos for lunch, carnitas for me and fish for her. Both meats perfectly cooked and mated with great complimentary ingredients such as avocado (with pork) and pineapple (with fish). Well prepared, well presented, and great flavors. A Granada cocktail made the meal perfect for a gorgeous afternoon in the City.
author: Phil And Kimber P.

description: I have been to Sabrosa a few times, but my most recent visit will be my last. Which is too bad because the food is OK, (agree that it is faux-Mexican but still tasty), the drinks are great, but the service is pretty terrible. We were there for Sunday brunch and our appetizers came before our drinks, and no silverware! We asked and it was forgotten, and way too long of a wait to ever see another waiter or anyone else that worked there. The host seemed to be doing most of the work, we barely saw our waitress. And it wasn't that busy! Past experience sitting at the bar was OK, but I agree with other reviewers that it is way too loud inside, the outdoor tables are better, unless they forget about you.
author: Renee D.

description: Yelp reviews are accurate-- nice ambience but food is mediocre to poor at best. Avoid unless you just want to drink!
author: Aaron S.

description: Finally got a chance to try the food and WOW, so good!!! The place is beautiful and the staff was very friendly and attentive.  I went with my co-workers and we all loved our food and had a wonderful time :) I definitely recommend this place for sure!!!!!!!
author: teri s.

description:
Made reservations for a large party of friends for a Friday night birthday dinner - the staff was super accommodating over the phone, even after multiple calls back to change the number of people.

Ambiance, food, drinks, and service were all excellent.  It has a great sharing menu, and the margarita pitchers don't hurt.  Our server was super friendly and very helpful in making sure our vegan friend was taken care of.

If you're looking for an interesting place to grab drinks before dinner, head over to Balboa Cafe kitty corner from the restaurant - it's one of the oldest bars in the city.

To sum it up, we had a blast.  I'll be going back.
author: Morgan H.

description: Ahh damn I just saw a 20% off on lunch on this place wish I saw this before I dropped $90 on food and drinks. That aside, this place was pretty good. Easy to screw up a Mexican brunch and I'm happy they didn't. I recommend any of their ceviches and their margaritas are good. Only thing was the service was a tad slow and they ran out of guacamole. You guys got stay on top of that!
author: Al S.

description:
Food is fine.  Good but not amazing. 

I went in the evening with a friend.  It was so loud we could not have a conversation.

If you are looking for a really loud bar scene (the margaritas are good) then this is a could place.
author: kathy l.

description: When this place first opened it was great but the last time I went there the food was horrible.  My friend had to send her steak back and they took off a lot of the great vegetarian options they had before.  I would go here for a margarita but that is about it.
author: Lisa V.

description: Best Mexican food I've ever had :) yummy.  Even their simple Caesar salad was supper fresh with a nice warm piece of chicken on the side. Loved it. Can't wait to try other things on the menu. The place looks awesome as well. Very fun environment even if your going just for a drinks. Would dfntly recommend it to friends.
author: Tina M.

description:
Let's just focus on the food. The atmosphere resembled a bar and not a restaurant: loud music and drunk people.

Sabrosa easily comes in as one of the worst meals I have had in San Francisco. There were literally no redeeming qualities.

1) Took 15 - 20 minutes to be seated with a reservation.
2) The waitress took another 20 minutes to come to our table (we were about 1 min away from walking out).
3) Had the trio of salsa and chips as an appetizer. Chips were a stale pita bread. Salsas were bland/something you would find off the shelf in low-end grocery store.
4) The tacos had a foul cheese on top which resembled cheese wiz and made me feel nauseous eating them. From the looks of it, the plate appeared microwaved or at best reheated.
5) The rib eye steak was ordered medium rare. It came out at least well-done and burnt on the outside. The quality of meat was very low quality. There was some sort of watery potato puree on the side and soggy greens. I did not finish it.

Do yourself a favor and just skip this place for food.
author: Daniel R.

description: I came here with my son in law for brunch after hearing rave reviews from friends and I have to say the rumors are true, this place is fantastic. Just what the Marina needed, a fresh, upscale, intimate place where you can enjoy a custom cocktail or share a few things from their modern menu. Definitely check it out, five stars in my book.
author: Marcia S.

description: Food is disgusting here! Taco bell tastes more better than here lol and that's pretty sad. We also ordered a pitcher of magarita, so sour and way too sweet. Very disappointed. If you're looking for non-authentic, non-flavorful, overly priced mexican food, than this is the spot for you!
author: Kim N.

description: Wow, super impressed with the food, drinks and service from Sabrosa. My friends and We have been here 3 times over the past week, twice for dinner and once for brunch. Without question, we all agree this is the best Mexican food we have ever tried.  We tried about 6 different dishes and everything was incredible.  The tequila drinks pack a punch and are tasty and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Roberta W.

description: A couple of friends and I stopped in here for Saturday brunch last week and had a great time.  Our server Katie was so sweet and full of personality.  She made sure to keep our drinks full at all times which is a must for the group that I was with.  We will definitely be putting this place at the top of our Saturday brunch spots.
author: Jack C.

description: Went here on the suggestion of the concierge at the Ritz. It was great. The food was authentic and something that you don't have the ability to normally get from Mexican fair in the city. Atmosphere was terrific and most importantly the cocktails were fantastic.
author: Ltrain M.

description: This is one of my new favorite restaurants in SF.  Great food (fresh, everything done on-site/in-house) and attentive, friendly service.  There is a lot of passion in the experience/venue from the design to the food & drink (awesome cocktails by the way).  It's a great place to saddle up at the bar, or the communal tables in the middle.  Or grab a table for a date or group dinner.  Very versatile and spacious.  Sabrosa's a wonderful addition to the "triangle" - fresh and vibrant revamp of the old bar that used to be there.  Seems like Sabrosa akeeps getting better and better as it matures from newbie to hopefully SF institution.  Thumbs up!
author: Sun H.

description: Came in here Sunday to watch some of the Niners game. The bartender refused to put on the Niners game because he had money on the Seahawks game. I had to ask him twice to put it on. Two other customers wanted to watch the Giants game on the other TV and he refused. The waiter also screwed up our order and brought us the wrong entree. Pretty lame experience. Apparently the customer is always wrong at Sabrosa.
author: B L.

description: Best Mexican food and margaritas in the Marina! I had no idea Mexican food could be so fresh and healthy. The "Pepino" aka cucumber margarita is my favorite with just a the right amount of heat to it and the "caldo xochilt" aka soup is better than my grandmothers! LOVE this place I've gone back almost every week since it opened. :)
author: Carla M.

description:
I know Sabrosa is considered upscale Mexican, but no chips and salsa for free?! Sacrilege! Being a chips and salsa enthusiast, I of course ordered some. Chips are thick and sparse, with bland (but fresh) salsa. I splurged on the guacamole too. It was very straightforward with clean, whole ingredients, (read: lacking flavor). The pumpkin seeds were a nice, unique touch. Like the chips, the portion was small. Like all of their portions. They use quality ingredients in everything though, which is especially attractive in regards to their margaritas. Delish! Although I could probably stop at Whole Foods and make the same thing at home for cheaper. But cocktails always taste better when you pay $11 for them, right?!
Definitely stay away when they're busy. They can't seem to manage multiple tables at once. And DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT SITTING OUTSIDE. It'll take them 20 minutes before they remember you're out there and bring you water. Like us, you may end up just leaving.
author: Jadeen Y.

description: The enchiladas were great and the drinks are always tasty. The music adds to the Great ambiance/nightlife. Giving this 4/5 stars only because I had one meal many months ago that was basically all tortilla chips and dry chicken. I didn't like it :)
author: Jessica L.

description: This is the place to be!! Great vibe and beautiful layout. Not only is this place great for drinks but the food was amazing! We tried many dishes including the ceasar salad, skirt steak tacos, and main steak dish and they were all delicious. Hands down my new favorite spot for mexican food in the city.
author: Dino E.

description:
New place, stumbled in, outstanding!!!
Best macho something margarita.  I'm in SF twice a month for work and this  will be my new place of choice...
author: Jack B.

description: It's my first time back since the opening and WOW the menu is totally different and I'm all about everything I had.  So good and I will go out of my way to eat here now! Compliment's to the chief.
author: Fred H.

description: YUM!!!!!!! The food here is so freakin delicious! Spicy mescal margarita blew my mind. Super sweet staff. I would come here for a great sit down meal of healthy, flavorful Mexican or a fun night out drinking. Will definitely be back.
author: Arjuna D.

description: Stopped in for happy hour with a girlfriend.. While the guac was great, the service was bad.. Waitress was rude and bartender was as well. Nice place if you can get a table outside but not sure I would return again based on service
author: L D.

description: Very poorly run restaurant.  Super slow service.  Mediocre food.  Some good drinks.  Expensive for mexican food.  Nice space.
author: Neo M.

description: We went for lunch....we ordered cocktails, soup and tacos.  The cocktails were good, but they forgot our lunch order and we had to wait 45 minutes for the food, while other customers around us were promptly served.  The caldo de pollo was bland, flavorless.  The fish taco was too sweet with the pineapple and the fish had no flavor.  The carne asada tacos were flavorful, good. Beware, the tacos are $10 and are two bites for a taco, quite pricey.  We have lived and traveled extensively in Mexico, and this is a poor representation of the food found there.  We will definitely not return.
author: susan f.

description: Went back last Friday evening to give it another try. Again overpriced guacamole that needed salt. We asked for salt from three different people before we finally got it. It was not busy to be the reason it took so long. The ceviche was ok and the tacos were fine. It took way too long for the check to come despite people checking on us too much while eating they seemed to forget about us when we finished our meal and drinks. I had to go inside and ask for the check. All in all the food is fine but not worth the price.
author: Danielle K.

description: This place has especially good Mexican food that is not the typical fare.  I am picky and I have never been disappointed
author: John W.

description: Been here several times over the last year. This spot has made a few changes. New paint job in the inside and a new menu. My friends and I had the carnitas tacos, fish tacos and the carne asada entree. Not sure how they make the carnitas but they seemed to have a slight cinnamon essence to them which   were so tasty. The carne asada came out on a sizzling iron platter which I thought was a cool way to serve it. Our server was new to working there but she did an awesome job. Really attentive and was always around when we needed to order another drink. We all had their spicy margarita made with what tasted like fresh lime juice. Sabrosa keeps getting better and better. Definitely on my rotation when I visit the Marina.
author: Michael F.

description: My friends and I visited Sabrosa today for brunch.  What a great looking space!  The food was actually pretty good and my Bloody Mary was awesome however the service was horrible.  We had to flag our waitress and another waiter down twice (for drinks and food).  The restaurant was not busy - our waitress spent most of her time near the bar and not checking in with her tables.  After finally receiving our food, the 3 entrees were served at different times (first two entrees 10 minutes apart and cold).  The waitress made a comment about how my friend should just start eating without the rest of the table.  Hmmm.  New wait staff needed!  This local will not be back.
author: Marty B.

description: Good tacos.  Fantastic guacamole with a pomegranate seeds on top.  Very good sangria.  Happy hour deals are... so-so.
author: Andy S.

description: I rarely ever use yelp, but I had to review this place. Went here for dinner and the experience was less than satisfactory . They are extremely understaffed. Our waitress was great and a hard worker but I'm pretty sure she was the only one working the entire restaurant and it was slammed . Our drinks took 30 min to get to is and our dinner about an hour: the food was "eh" not worth the price or the time. The restaurant itself is beautiful so well done there ....
author: Jessica H.

description: WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. My hubby and I don't often get motivated to go out for Sunday brunch, so when we do, it's a "special occasion," and we really go all out. We had been to Sabrosa in November a couple of weeks after they had opened for dinner and thought it was OK. The service was fine, the drinks were good, the chips and salsa weren't our favorite but they did the trick. The food, I don't even remember what I ordered...I think it was a quesadilla? My husband ordered a veggie entree of some sort and said it lacked flavor, but figured he had made a poor decision to begin with, ordering a boring vegetarian dish. Anyway, we were out with our pup so needed somewhere with outdoor seating. Mexican food is one of our favorite cuisines so we decided to give Saborsa another shot. Such a bad decision...while we were waiting to sit down, one of the servers sneezed the loudest sneeze I've ever heard, into his sleeve before entering back into the restaurant. We both said, "gross," but were glad it just wasn't near any food. We were sat quickly - the one positive event during our experience. It was between 10-15 minutes before the server acknowledged us. Since we had so much time to look at the menu, we quickly ordered the salsa trio and guacamole to start with. For entrees, the grilled chicken, cojito, lemon and pistachio "cesar salad," and the pumpkin seed sauce enchiladas with mashed potato, queso casero, hard boiled eggs & salsa chiltomate. The salad was very presentable, the taste on the other hand was so bitter. The lemon was so overwhelming that I couldn't taste anything else. How can you mess us delicious crisp romaine, pistachios, cheese, and grilled chicken?! It was like the salad was tossed in one pound of lemon rind and some oil. Good thing the grilled chicken wasn't tossed in the salad. I at least filled up on the grilled chicken - my dog did too! So disappointing. The "pumpkin" enchiladas...very interesting. They were saturated in a green flavorless sauce. They were indeed filled with mashed potatoes but we aren't sure what happened to the cheese or pumpkin. They were completely flavorless. We have come to conclusion that they have officially mastered mixing what should be awesome ingredients together into flavorless ensembles. So bizarre. Do not waste your Sunday brunch at Sabrosa. It was literally depressing walking home and passing by at least half a dozen other restaurants and seeing the scrumptious foods on the patron's plates. Our experience completely changed the tone and mood of the day. Such a shame. We had high hopes for a great sit down full service Mexican restaurant opening up in the area, but Sabrosa just cannot pull it off. Sadly we will not be returning. P.S. the reason I gave this place two stars and not one, is because it was not as bad as the worst restaurant in SF, CHOUQUETS!
author: Kelsey K.

description: This place is awesome! All of the food was perfect, atmosphere great, and the whole staff was very nice. On a side note, we brought a small kid and they were very accommodating. I really can't wait to go back again!
author: K E.

description: This spot really has it together. Seems like a well run joint and it's great for big groups. I've been on several occasions and the service has always been excellent. I drink a ton of water and the little tequila bottles they bring you for water are on point. Big fan of h2o. That sh*t is nice. Best item is the tlocoyo. Its a brunch item though.
author: Michael P.

description: You MUST try DJ's Kick Ass Mule (Kicking Mule), it's unreal! Spicy, sweet, and oh so delicious. And the steak. Must get the steak!
author: Mary W.

description: We stopped in for drinks and appetizers.  The guacamole and chips and 3 different hot sauces were really, really tasty.  It has a nice ambiance at happy hour.  The service was excellent - great bartenders who are very attentive.  I saw the early diners get their entrees and it all looked very good.  We'll definitely come back to have dinner here.
author: Jenny B.

description: Just what the marina needed. Love the location, love the food, love the decor - solid restaurant.
author: Sean T.

description: The service and food definitely leave something to be desired.  The food is pricey, not awesome, and served in small portions.  Even when slow the service isn't great.  It seems like it would be a cool bar scene, but I won't be back.  I live in the neighborhood and have visited for brunch and dinner.  Probably a good spot just for drinks.
author: Chris C.

description:
I've been to Sabrosa three times now and every meal has been amazing. For brunch I had the Brussel sprouts with poached egg yolk and leeks.  So good, I finished the whole thing,(I was by myself) and the Chilaquiles rojo were some of the best I've had. I loved that there were beans in them.
When I had dinner at Sabrosa I ate with friends and shared a lot of different dishes.  My two favorite were the Brussel sprout quesadilla and the Caldo. I could eat that soup everyday.  So beautiful and delicious. 
So Sabrosa does a happy hour now and it's so awesome.  This is now my favorite time to go in. The bar isn't too crowded and the calamari tac's are such a good deal. These tacos kind of blew my mind.  Fried calamari and a tomato, caper and green olive salsa. So good!!! 
And lastly I've had such sweet servers and bartenders.  Barney (our server) was such sweetheart and Jon ( bartender) was hilarious and made me some delicious drinks.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Sammy S.

description: The last warm weather evening in SF brought us to this new neighborhood gem. The staff are very friendly, and attentive. Great non-alcoholic beverages! The atmosphere is very nice and airy feeling. The downside are the portions...very small for the money they charge. I would recommend this restaurant for a first date or a quick drink with friends.
author: Kimberly L.

description: We've now been to sabrosa twice and both times we've been, we've been disappointed with the quality of the cocktails we've ordered. While one of the main complaints is the pricing for a very average margarita, admittedly you're paying for the decor and location when one ventures into the triangle - sabrosa, eastside west, and balboa. I still think there are far better options for a drinks in the area - I'd say tacolicious is the better option between the two. So if you're into the whole triangle scene, I get it and you can justify going to sabrosa, for everyone else not so much...
author: Andrew B.

description: It is very rare for me to post reviews.  In the case of Sabrosa, I'm only doing so because I don't think the restaurant will make it unless it dramatically upgrades its service.  I've been twice.  Both times, everyone at the table agreed that the food was excellent.  The guacamole is fantastic, the brunch menu is creative and delicious and the lunch/dinner menu is also great.  The problem is the service.  The first time we went, multiple orders came back wrong (a chorizo scramble with no chorizo???!!!  Seriously?)  The second time, it wasn't until I was actually eating that I was told that they were out of beans - so I wouldn't be getting any with my order.  How can a Mexican restaurant be out of beans??!!  Lastly, the wait staff is extremely lack luster and SLOW.  They aren't trained on the menu (they can't answer any questions about the dishes or drinks), and presenting the basics like, water, salt, pepper and hot sauce seems to really put them out.  If this isn't frustrating enough, during both visits our waitress/waiter disappeared for long stretches.  This is really hard to do in such a small restaurant.  All in all, I'll wrap it up by saying that Sabrosa's fresh and delicious food is superb.  But the service is so poor, I find the dining experience to be frustrating and disappointing.  I hope management will see this post as helpful criticism.  I really do want Sabrosa to succeed.
author: Cookie B.
